The best part of the meal was their chocolate beignets. They're not traditional beignets. The shape reminds me of a doughnut hole but the texture and taste reminds me of a molten lava cake. Creamy hot chocolate oozing inside covered by a crispy chocolate cake outside. We had two orders of that.

Service was on point here and they constantly came to check up on us. My friend didn't like his dish (some spaghetti dish) and they gladly took it back and gave him a new dish. That's service!

Here's the thing, Prostrio does NOT play into the Vegas showmanship that surrounds it and that what's makes it a good restaurant.  

This is a simple, American bistro. Great salads and simple wood oven baked pizzas and entrées that are simple and approachable (meatloaf with potato puree mushroom gravy and buttermilk onion rings).  Its the kind of place that you can feel just as comfortable having a beer as a good glass of wine.

Eaten here many times and the food is consistently good.  Fresh ingredients used throughout.  There are no real standouts and that is part of the restaurants appeal.

Friendly service.

Very fair prices for a Vegas resort restaurant.

The food is average, I had their version of Linguini and clams and it was not as good as any little independent Italian restaurant in NY or Jersey can do, and of course way more expensive with the WP name behind (that's really what you're paying for).    The wine list is mediocre and pricey, and let's not forget that because of all the mod, hard surfaces, this place is so loud you'll need to yell at your friends over dinner.      So, not bad but not that great either.

Well the feel of this place is fabulous.  You really feel like you are in Venice when you sit "outside" the restaurant.  It is a fabulous feel.  I went here for lunch with a group.  For lunch I split a caprese salad and a lobster club.  Well the salad was unbelievable.  The heirloom tomatoes were amazing and the balsamic was aged and yummy.  The lobster club was just OK.  Nothing special for the price.  Someone at our table had a pizza which was UNBELIEVABLE.  I should have known being at a Wolfgang Puck restaurant to order the pizza. I  would go back and split the pizza instead.

This is based on a catered free experience.

I gotta say I had some great food experiences here.

The tuna tartare wasn't amazing, but was very good. The beef slider was really interesting (though over cooked). The pepperoni pizza with olives was awesome! totally loved that! The chicken satay was really meh...stupid white meat chicken lovers...

I might try it for lunch before I leave...it was really enjoyable :)

I stopped in for a quick bite one afternoon and had the tuna tartar was excellent and the caprese salad was very flavorful. I sat at the bar and the bar tenders were friendly and the service was great. Next time I am in town and I am going to try this place for dinner.

We had a reservations for our party of 15. When we arrived at the restaurant, the staff had set up three separate tables.  When I asked to have the tables put together, the manager had a serious attitude with me. So we walked out and took our business to another restaurant.

Yummmmm!!!!  I got the steak with lobster mashed potatoes.  The steak was just okay; I've had better, but the mashed potatoes were AMAZING!!  There were actually huge chunks of lobster in it.  I just kept eating everything else off my plate just so that I could save the mashed potatoes for last.  

The service was really good.  We were taking our time at dinner and just enjoying each others' company.  The server didn't seem to mind when he had to come back several times to see if we were ready to order.  

Good food, good company, good times.  I would do it again in a heartbeat.

Mean mean mean mean mean.

We ordered their $150 wine. Because I wasn't all that impressed with the wine, the waiter decided to ignore us entirely for the rest of our dinner. I literally had to flag down another waiter to give us our check.  We spent $300 on our meal, I think some professionalism is requested if not required.

Never coming back in ever again, unless someday I feel compelled to vent to the manager for 5 hours of my horrid experience.

Peking duck was surprisingly close to authentic. Endless bread. Delicious drink (I forgot what mine was called, but it included some tropical fruits & rum). A bit pricy, but what do you expect from Wolfgang Puck? :)  This lovely restaurant is in the Venetian and, if you're lucky, you can get seated "outside" and listen to Italian opera singers while you dine. 

Gets major brownie points for being located right across from Jimmy Choo & Burberry!

Overall had a great time at Postrio. 
Atmosphere was nice, drinks were great. 
However, service tended to be slow and food for the price wasn't fantastic. My  prosutto pizza was too salty and non adventurous. It noted it had pesto and goat cheese on it, but where was it? Also had requested mushrooms to be added and this was forgotten. Nearly a $20 personal pizza. 
The Aviation drink I had was simply delicious. Crisp and refreshing. 
We had a large group with us and they were accomodating to our group. Drinks came out incredibly slow as did food. No huge deal as we weren't in a rush but frustrating when we were so hungry! :)

I would recommend Postrio for a nice evening out in Vegas!

Their menu was divided into Small plate, Medium plates, Large plates... 

Starter: I loved their bread with onions on it! It went perfectly with the fluffy butter spread (almost like whipped cream). It would have been better if it just came out of the oven or was heated... but still delicious nonetheless. 

We had the tuna small plate - which was kinda like sashimi with wasabi, tomatoes, olive oil and a splash of citrus condiment on it. Very smooth cut of tuna... but it was definitely no O-toro. I would have guessed it was Akami toro by the deep pinkish color of the cut. Very lean. Hardly any fats at all. I didn't care for the citrus taste. I thought it mashed weirdly with the olive oil and wasabi... but that's the risk with fusion, isn't it? Portion was also very small. 6 slices for $21. 

The next dish we had was the seafood linguine - Medium plate. It was a huge portion! Highly recommend by the server and he did not disappoint! It was delicious. Al dente pasta! Perfecto! Very generous helping of prawns and squid too. Would come back for this dish again!

I love their signature beignets... but unfortunately was too carbo loaded to eat another bite! 

Our server was very attentive and enthusiastic... granted there weren't many tables at 5pm but still kudos to great service :)
Great drinks!  We had Elderflower martinis - they were yummy!  The food was great too.  As always Vegas was a little pricey.

Definitely a good place for lunch and something light to eat. I actually dined here by myself after a great day of sunbathing, and shopping and need a little r and r to myself. Yes I can do that while my party parted ways with me, and I must admit that eating by myself and just being quiet is pretty lovely. Anyhow, enough about myself. 

linguine frutti de mari with a grey goose pineapple shaken made it a perfect lunch. I wouldn't say that it was any better than a dish at macaroni grill but definitely great service, and good enough food. I can't tell you enough that with food from san francisco, and seattle has spoiled me, and these chef inspired restaurants are just beneath me now. sorry...

We had a really great dinner here one of the nights of our vacation. We stayed in the Venetian, and wanted to grab some dinner right downstairs. I'm glad we chose Postrio.

Wine was good, and so was my pomegranate martini.

For an app, we started with the Butter Lettuce Caesar Salad. Pretty good!

For dinner, I had the Free Range Chicken - which was d e l i c i o u s. Seriously one of the best free ranges I've had. The yukon potato "puree", which is just fancy for mashed poatoes, was excellent. I meant to ask what sauce was over the chicken, because it went so well with the potatoes. Just a really enjoyable plate all around.
 
My boyfriend ordered the ricotta qnocchi. A really small portion, but he loved it. Couldn't stop talking about how good it was.

We skipped on dessert, but I'm sure its good based on all the reviews about it.

We had such a great dinner, we even came back for a second time before our vacation was over.

This is a review of the Postrio CAFE.

While I was not thrown out of this world by any of the food or service, it was a solidly decent meal.  It was our last meal in town, we were tired and ready to jump on the plane home and wanted something a bit more 'comforting'.  Postrio was able to provide this without fail. 

Our meal began with two tropical unsweetened iced teas (their standard iced tea) and an order of fritto misto of calamari, shrimp and summer veggies drizzled with balsamic vinegar and arugula.  It was cooked just right and the balsamic vinegar added a nice flavor (although to be honest, it took me a couple bites to figure out what the 'black' liquid was all over the food).

The husband ordered lasagna, which i personally wasn't all that impressed with - it seemed soggy and watery, although the sausage they used was homemade and tasted great.  He loved it.  I ordered an angus cheeseburger.  I asked for it to be cooked 'medium' and it came out medium well, which was okay since that is  what I usually order, but it definitely wasn't cooked as I had requested.  The fries were good and the pickle tasted homemade and I enjoyed every last crunchy bite of it.

Dessert was delicious as well and we had no problem polishing it off.  It was a blueberry gelato served over a blueberry crumble.  It was very good, but nothing phenomenal.

If you're looking for a culinary adventure, the cafe may not be the best stop, but it's great for a slightly upscale casual meal (with an upscale pricetag to go with it).  The cafe wasn't full and seems to be readily available without reservations.

Very nice place with great service! I had the handmade-homestyle lasagna and it was awesome...pasta was freshly made! Service was top notch. My fork accidentally fell on the floor and before I could even think about picking it up and asking for a new one the waiter had already picked it up and handed me a new one. Food was simple yet elegant and drinks were amazing. Waiter was very nice and friendly. I had a great time and will be coming back next time for sure!

I was soooo happy I ate here. I had fantastic service and has a great food! I also got all the bread, and more importantly, balsamic vinegar, I needed because I was starving prior to my meal coming, which was prompt I might add. The waiter was amazing, and I will definitely come back!

We stopped here for lunch today and really liked it. We were seated on the "patio" area which was fun for people watching. The service was excellent, as was the food.  Highly recommend the sausage pizza.

Reading all the reviews, I expected to get mediocre service.. but I was pleasantly surprised. Our server was very attentive and very cool.
We ordered...
-the LINGUINI with CLAMS and PANCETTA was very tasty... the linguini was perfectly al dente which is hard to find with fresh pasta.
-my husband ordered the HONG KONG STYLE HALIBUT.. which I thought was ok, but he loved it... it was a little too tart for me. He said you have to have each component of the meal to balance out. I personally would never order it.. but he would totally order over and over again.
-they have a kids menu.... and my daughter got the cheesy pasta... it was simple and my daughter cleaned her plate. Too bad that you have to order each thing separately... we had to order her milk separately... which was like an extra $2.50 or $2.75.
-SANGRIA.. was really tasty. the apples were really crisp. The pitcher was only $25.. how can you beat that?

oh.. and the bread.. VERY GOOD... crusty on the outside and soft on the inside... and the olive tapenade that they serve with is.... mu-ah! I could just eat that ALL day long!

Overall... will definitely be back!

FOUR CHEESE RAVIOLI, VINE RIPENED TOMATO SAUCE.....order it, I think it might be some of the BEST ravioli I have ever eaten!! I want to learn how to make that sauce it was truly delicious and so was the margarita pizza. The crab cakes were also wonderful~ not overly cooked or fried and had a really nice sauce, tasted super fresh.  

The service wasn't great, but the people watching was a treat! I would choose this over Otto any day.

The evening here was somewhat disappointing. We had made reservations a week ahead and arrived on time. We were seated after waiting about 10 minutes in the inside dining room, which was nice. We waited over 15 minutes before our drink order was taken by a very disinterested server. We then waited over 25 minutes for our drinks to arrive. The dining room was only half full on a Sunday evening. 

I had taken finally ONE sip of my drink and the food arrived less than two minutes after the drinks arrived. Ar this point we were not happy with the constant delays and the continued disinterest by the server. 

My husband's liver/onions was delicious. My roasted potatoes were also very good, but the crab cakes were mushy and tasteless. I only ate one of the four very tiny crabcakes. They did take 1/2 of the cost of the crabcakes off of the bill, which was a nice gesture, but we were annoyed by the delays and poor attitude. We had been looking forward to a relaxing evening after a long day of business, but instead left quickly and without ordering anything else. Had the service been good, I could have been much more forgiving with the blah crabcakes because the rest of the food was very good. We wont be back.
Love, love this place!  Try these and you can't go wrong:  homemade pasta, chocolate beignets, and Armando, who is possibly the best waiter out there.  We love Armando!!!

Went here for dinner with my girlfriends when we first got to Vegas.  I've been to Spago in Caesar's before, and thought it was very similar.  I was really looking forward to their pizza since I loved the pizza both at Spago and at Wolfgang Puck Express, and while it was good here, it didn't seem as good as what I've had before...I think the crust could have been a little thinner and more crunchy.  All 3 of us were starving though so we practically inhaled the pizza anyway.

For main course, I got the burger, which was excellent and perfectly juicy...I only wish I hadn't filled up too much on their pizza since this was so much better.  The fries were perfectly fried, and crispy just the way I like it.  I was already way stuffed but I kept picking at the fries towards the end of the meal.

Probably my largest criticism here is that their wines by the glass really sucked.  I gotta admit that I'm a little picky when it comes to wines, but for a "nice" restaurant like this, I thought that I would at least get something that didn't make me grimace when I drank it.  I got the pinot with the pizza, which was bleah and a little vinegary to me (maybe it had been open for a while?), then got a malbec with my burger which was a little better but still meh.  I got several $10-$20 bottles at home that taste better than this stuff.

One thing I really liked though was the location.  You had that pseudo-outdoor feel with the fake sky and all, kind of reminded me of those restaurants in italy with the outdoor tables.  Of course in this case, you're in a mall, but it was nice nonetheless, and we got to people-watch as we ate dinner (always a fun thing to do in Vegas).

Boo for them though for not giving me the 1000 points for the opentable reservation when I booked it on my iphone (it was 1000 points when I looked it up on my pc earlier).  At least we had a 25% off coupon that came with our room at the Venetian, so our whole dinner wound up being pretty reasonable (for Vegas).

All in all, don't really regret going here, since we had a discount and they took reservations at the last minute, but don't know if I would actually seek out this place again given that there are so many great restaurants in Vegas.

By far, the worst service I have experienced ever. Upon first arriving, we were seated at the very far corner of the outdoor seating. Of our table setting, we had one filthy plate and one cracked glass that the wait staff failed to notice. When we ordered, our waiter (who "conveniently" failed to give us his name) kept us waiting much longer than the other guests. When we asked, he explained that the restaurant was packed inside (no, it wasn't) and that exact words: "well-done burger doesn't help". Because we ordered our burger charred?

Before we ever saw our food, we asked for the manager to address our concerns. He finally came out right when the food did, which by the way came out all at different times, and his timing couldn't have been better. Our food was finally there. The gnocchi - cold. The pizza - cold. Our burgers - overdone.

The manager didn't even do anything! When we talked to him, he had NOTHING to say. We ate the cold, unsatisfying meal and when we wanted to leave, the manager was kind enough to order desserts for us, which we also waited for. By then, our count was almost an hour of waiting.

Despite talking to the manager, the service still didn't improve. Not once were we asked if we needed something else or if the food was good. 

Simply put, I will not be returning.

Sea Bass ++++++   $32
Scallops   ++++++   $33
Pumpkin Tortellini (appetizer)  ++++++ $16

I'm local to Vegas and have eaten everywhere.  That meal was amazing!

I have to step outside of myself to write this review: I don't typically dine at restaurants in Postrio's stratum.

That being said, I can echo the sentiment about the service. It was very classy and meticulous. Our waters were always filled (with Voss), warm towels, replacement of napkins upon return from the restroom, the impression that our server tried to forge as intimate a relationship with our party as he could. 

I got the fish special: a Mediterranean sea bass that was filleted, table-side. It was a 'reasonable' $35 and served on a bed of beluga lentils + greens. It was tremendous.

I couldn't eat the appetizer that the rest of my party ordered (shellfish platter) but the presentation was great and they all seemed very satisfied.

Would I dine there, again? Yes, but only when I felt like I could afford $100+ (w/wine) per person: maybe after a good night at the tables, perhaps? As it were, my tab was picked up by my company, God love 'em.

Umami!  This was my all time favorite restaurant!  The lobster sandwich was the best experience my mouth has ever savored!    The tuna tartare was phenomenal!  It's a shame Postrio and the Venetian divorcedHopefully one of their other restaurants has a similar menu.  I will miss this restaurant!

So I take a little work trip to Vegas, get put in a crappy hotel, and by the second night I've had enough. I make reservations at Harrah's, where I'm upgraded to a suite. I spend an hour in a jacuzzi bathtub and head out to find good eats.

It was suggested to me that I try some sushi place, but when I found it the place was loud and all I wanted was a quiet and mellow place I could relax, have a drink, and eat.

Ended up passing this place and circling back around. The bar was inviting, so I sat at it. The bartender who served me, Lord help me I've now forgotten his name, was knowledgeable and friendly. 

Something stirred me and for the first time ever I ordered a glass of bubbly. To go with it, a pizza with so many awesome cheeses and mushrooms I could have died happy after the last bite. 

I made friends with the couple next to me, a very nice couple also from Southern California. We chatted and discussed our food. It was a very pleasant environment and in large part that was provided by the bartenders.

I'll be honest, I never go to Vegas. I'm more of a cultural hub junky when it comes to traveling. This was my first trip to Vegas in 14 years. If/when I return, i will be going to this restaurant again. My only hope is that the same bartenders are still working there and their food quality does not diminish.

I had booked a table to celebrate my sister's and my birthday and let the hostess know that when I booked as she asked if there was a special occasion.  But, I was quite surprised that not even a cupcake was offered as a treat!  The food was good but overpriced and the service was just minimal.  I would not go here again.

A great spot to enjoy lunch if you find yourself in the Venetian...

I like Postrio because it combines a good people watching opportunity with great cocktails.  The food leaves a bit to be desired, and coming with Wolfgang Puck's name on it, one automatically thinks it will be something it is not.  

The few times I've been here I always leave saying the same thing:  "Next time I'm just having drinks."  The cocktails here are fantastic.  Very creative and well made drinks are enough to keep me coming back, especially the cognac and lemon juice martini, mmm mmm!

Most recently we ordered:

Margarita Pizza - Straight forward mozzarella flavor, nothing developed or complex, very underperforming pizza.

Salt n' Pepper Calamari and Shrimp -  Perfectly light and flaky coating, good flavor, delicious sweet chili dipping sauce, just a good appetizer.

Chopped salad - What was he thinking?  This salad worries me, it shouldn't  be on the menu.  There are what I take to be pickled figs in here, which do what capers often do to dishes, overpower them.  This unbalanced bowl of greens is an expensive mish mosh of salad bar rejects.

Cesar Salad - Very crisp lettuce and a light dressing were a nice way to continue through our meal.  Think Cesar Salad's less chubby cousin.

Pumpkin Tortelloni in Brown Butter Sage sauce - Overpowering sage flavor, whoa!  The pasta itself was very well made, and I had no issue with the pumpkin in the noodle, but the sauce failed to accentuate anything on the dish.  It really just screamed Sage, and not in a good way.

Besides the good location, Namesake, and drinks, Postrio falls short of being a great restaurant.
Love coming here. Their meatballs with the spaghetti are ridiculously good and i love the chicken milanese.

This review is based solely on their cocktails and small plate menu. I've been here three times now and sat twice at the bar and once in the dining room. The number one reason that I come back is for the Pear Martini. It is not like any other pear martini I've tried because it is made with fresh pear puree instead of a syrup. I HIGHLY reccomend this drink to anyone and everyone! We have also tried the Charcuterie plate, meatballs, house made popcorn, spicy pepperoni pizza, and the calamari. Our favorite is the meatballs which are served with a crispy baguette to dip in the sauce. If nothing else, we come here to enjoy the cocktails and people watch at The Palazzo.

I asked the waiter for his recommendation between a couple of entrees, and he highly recommended the meatloaf, so that's what I ordered.  Nice presentation but the meatloaf itself was kinda dry. The onion rings that came with it were outstanding.

We came here by chance after watching The Phantom of the Opera.  It was the only place that we didn't have to wait in line & with the ticket stubs, we got a 25% discount on the entire bill!  Totally worth it!

Appetizers were tasty.  We had the octopus (okay, not great), french fries (super yummy with an aioli dipping sauce) & prosciutto and melon (there's no way to mess this up :-p).

The entrees were better than the appetizers.  The linguine & spicy lobster was the best of what we ordered.  Homemade pasta that was cooked perfectly.  I had the cioppino that was very nice, light and brothy, not too salty or too much tomato.  The halibut was a pretty big portion and pretty good (I didn't try it).  The only iffy entree was the calzone.  It was big but it wasn't anything special and was, apparently, barely warm in the middle, none the less, the guy finished it :-p.

I would definitely recommend the pasta & check the playbill at the Phantom for the discount.  We saved over $30.

First of all we were not suppose to go to this restaurant. My BF wanted to go to a Wolfgang restaurant but I ended up making reservations to the restaurant across from Pastrio. Oops. After realizing that this wasn't the place he wanted thank god the one he wanted to go was just across and just wlkd right over. 
Since it was my bday that day, I was thinking of having Stake but the menu didn't offer much with meat variety. 
We ended up getting the Pesto Shrimp Pizza and a Large plate of seafood past(sorry I forgot what it was called) Boy was I glad I didn't get stake because our orders were AWESOME!
the Pizza was sooooo fresh, goat cheese was flavorful and the Pasta flavor was perfect. 
I had white wine which blended so well. I can't wait to go back to Vegas and go back to this place. 
the price were reasonable and every penny was worth it.

A-OK. 3.49 Will have to go back to up it.

How to respond to the outdoor seating question I'm asked before submitting my review? I'm baffled given the faux-Venice atmosphere.

Burger was solid. It had some sort of tasty SECRET SECRET SECRET SAUCE on it. A little too huge for my preference. Fries were good, similar to Burger King in texture and cut.

Sat at the bar, service was excellent as is the standard in Vegas.

One of the reasons I chose Postrio for our "fancy" dinner in Vegas was the lack of bench seating.  Seriously.  If I'm going to spend $30-40/plate I don't want to be seated with strangers ala McDonald's.  Postrio doesn't make you sit with strangers so they immediately got an extra star from me.

They offered us the option of sitting in St. Mark's Square or in the dining room.  My husband indicated that it was our anniversary and let the host make the choice for us.  He sat us in the dining room because it's a bit quieter in there and we could sit closer together in a booth.

I had a martini with hennessy in it (sorry, don't remember the name) and an elderflower martini.  The hennessy martini was delicious!  My husband had a beer - don't remember which one.

I ordered the pancetta wrapped meatloaf, and my husband ordered the Kobe beef.  After tasting both, we agreed that mine was better... although I really enjoyed the chimichurri sauce on his beef.  

For dessert we shared the souffle.  I like mine to have more chocolate/cream sauce than was provided, but it was definitely good.

The wait staff was attentive and accommodating.  They brought out a black napkin so that I wouldn't have to worry about white lint on my black skirt.  I would definitely eat here again.

Our waitress gave good service but seemed like she was annoyed with us (and we weren't difficult).  Hubby had the cheese ravioli which was EXCELLENT but a small portion  I had, as always, the Lobster Club.  It's pricey ($32), but filled with yummy lobster.  The sweet potato fries are delicious too.  I like the ambiance of this place as you sit out in "open air" St. Mark's Square.

When you're sitting in the middle of St. Marks Square enjoying a delicious plate of pasta and glass of wine while being serenaded by a string ensemble, it's hard to believe your not in Italy, but instead in Las Vegas. Postrio Bar & Grill located in the Venetian Hotel on the Las Vegas Strip does just that. The ambiance, the food, the scenery, it's all great. While I highly recommend a stroll through the Venetian if you're ever on the strip, save Postrio for a special occasion. Their ever changing menu always includes delicious fresh pasta specials and great entrees packed with Wolfgang Puck's signature flavors. The food and atmosphere make any occasion special, and great company doesn't hurt either 
So cheers to great food, great friends and as always great travels!

*** Thx for an amazing lunch. ***

I was somewhat pressed for time.
All your tables were occupied but
I scooped an open stool at the bar.
The gracious hostess so obliged me.

My intention was to be quick in+out.
I had meatloaf since I skipped bfast.
The mushrooms and bacon were ;O!

Suddenly time became irrelevant so I
asked for the dessert menu.  Much to
my surprise, dessert was even better.

$19 Meatloaf
$10 Chocolate Beignets
$  4 Expresso

*** A serendipitous moment: priceless. ***

My friend and I went to Postrio on a recent trip to Vegas.  She had been there several times before - all good experiences.  After our evening there, I would never go back.  We were seated promptly (we had a reservation), but no one came to our table for 15 minutes.  Not to bring water or to tell us they'd be right with us.  Finally, our server came to the table and we were able to order wine.  10 minutes later, our wine arrived.  The server sat it on the table and said "I'll be right back to pour it" and went on to take drinks and checks to other tables.  The food was mediocre at best.  I had herb gnocchi with wild mushrooms, a caesar salad, and peach gallette for dessert.  My friend did seem to love her classic lasagna.  The food wasn't horrible... just nothing special.  I've eaten better at popular chain restaurants and expected more from a Wolfgang Puck gig.  Oh - and, we were seated out in the mall part of the restaurant, which completely killed the ambiance I would like when paying Postrio prices.
Calamari appetizer was quite good, pizza was not. I would probably avoid this restaurant (the Wolfgang Puck name doesn't have much cachet with me at this point).

Headline: Expensive, but the pizza is good @WolfgangBuzz does well in Vegas.

Postrio is in the heart of the venetian - second floor (where the canal is) and right on St. Marks Square.  You can sit "outside" if you want, and it certainly adds to the atmosphere.  Inside is a sleek modern dining room that doesn't detract from the charm of this place.  The music was a little too loud for my taste, but this is Las Vegas, after all.

Service was ok - slow to the point where I was looking for people, but not so slow that I was looking for a way out.  I definitely felt neglected though.

Let's talk food.  I had pizza - after all, it's what Wolfgang Puck is known for, and it didn't disappoint.  The crust was thin and perfectly cooked.  The tomato sauce was to die for - I'd love to know where they get their tomatoes because it actually tasted like tomatoes.  The toppings were delicious - mine was a collection of various meats together with mushrooms, chilis and onions.  I wish whoever was cleaning the chilis was a little more careful - one of mine had the seeds and membrane and almost blew my palate.

Since we were having such a convivial evening, we decided to order dessert.  A word of warning (and I wish the waiter had warned us prior to ordering) - the "Pucks Pies" take a while to bake as they are made fresh - expect a 15-ish minute wait.  I ordered the peach melba pie - really good.  I wish I could have had a warm custard option instead of the ice cream, which was nothing special.  The crumble topping was delicious and the pie came out nice and warm.

Definitely recommended place.

I think that the setting was more enchanting than anything else... in the middle of "Saint Mark's Square" within the Venetian Hotel and Casino. The food was decent, and even inventive on a few things (though not so inventive as to turn off the tourist trade), more than anything else the service was amazingly slow.

Amazing food!  I have a gluten allergy and I was offered a large variety of options. My husband had pizza of course and loved it. I had a Caesar salad with the chicken, potato purée and brussel sprouts. We really enjoyed our dinner. Yes it may be pricey but you get what you pay for. Quality!  And if you have food allergies like me that is extremely important. Thanks Wolfgang.

The food here is excellent though the menu was a bit all over the place in terms of what kind of food it was. But our service was great wished we could have had dessert. The "outdoor" experience was nice too. :)

Went here before the Phantom show...reservations at 5pm...no one said we couldn't eat inside the restaurant until 5:30 which was a disappointment.  We had to eat outside where it was noisy with all the crowds of people in St. Mark's Square.  Service was reallllly slow even though there were lots of people working.  My husband's grilled steak skewers were very good.  I had the salad with apples, dates, English cheddar.  The salad was good but  I found only 1 date & very little cheese.  The best part of the meal was dessert!  We had chocolate melting beignets with cream anglaise & cappucino ice cream.  This is probably the best dessert we have ever had!!  If we were to go back, it would be just for dessert & coffee.
We had a group of 10 people. They were very nice and seated us quickly. Everything we ordered was great and the prices were reasonable. The Venetian has a great selection of restaurants!

after breaking bank/emptying our wallets the night before at Olives, we opted for a slightly cheaper option.

I honestly cant remember most of the meal considering we were once again in a rush to get somewhere after.  But I do remember loving and devouring my linguine with clams!  everything was divine and not heavy at all.  

my one major suggestion for this place is to sit in the "patio" area as they so call it. the restaurant itself was kinda dark inside. I usually like that but it's just more fun to be pretending that your sitting outside on the streets of venice and watching the fake gondolas go by.

Of course the wide open restaurant in the middle of St. Marks Square is a must go! We were pleasantly pleased with the down to earth menu. I ordered the hamburger and wow! Yum! The seasoning was spot on, fresh tasting & huge! The bun was over the top no way was I eating this with my hands - fork & knife all the way! The service was good. A large bridal party was behind us and they were having the time of their lives! The vibe is FUN FUN.

I had been meaning to check out the burger at Postrio, and I was already at The Venetian checking out the eternal twilight of Saint Mark's Square. This Wolfgang Puck establishment delivered the culinary equivalent of "bad touch" from mom's new boyfriend. I should have known that everything was going to go terribly wrong from the painful interaction with the server..

Me: What are the cuts of beef in the burger?
She: Angus.
Me: That is a type of cow. I am more interested in the parts of the cow that the meat comes from so that I can order my burger cooked to a temperature that is most appropriate. Can you please go check?
She: *huff*
Me: Am not trying to be a pain; I am trying to order the burger correctly so that I can properly review it.

I assumed that she was new or fussy or just plain bad at her job. I failed to take this as an omen. The other clue was that the restaurant was all but empty in the middle of the bustling St. Mark's Square. Postrio was Italian slang for "crappy food and service."   

The beef was flavorful and beefy. Sadly, it was over-cooked and rubbery. The burger patty had the shape and texture of a fist. Beyond that, the burger was peppered with connective tissue. 

The burger's exterior tasted like an oniony salt. It was as if it had been dusted with cheap onion soup mix.

The bun was stale and dry...really dry and stale. The bun was burned to the point of tasting like carbon. The bottom of the bun had black grill marks, which imparted a nasty bitterness directly to the tongue.

The kitchen at Postrio phoned it in and subsequently dropped the ball. After I sent my meal back, there was no offer for a refire or a make-good of any sort. Apparently, that was their best effort.

The manager, Luckas, agreed that the bun was burned and stale and that the burger was rubbery. I sent my plate back after a scant 3 bites.My son got through a third of his before he gave up due to the strong flavor of char. I was granted the "friends and family discount." Postrio only charged me $37 for that shameful mess. Jerks!

Front and back of house were a well-oiled machine designed to lighten wallets and deliver awful food. Postrio earned the title of worst burger in Las Vegas. On the day that I visited, the quality of the burger and service was excremental, and that was being generous.

After a bit of back and forth over email, Postrio did refund the cost of the meal.
Their chicken salad is very good (not as good as it used to be with the port wine soaked grapes). It is served on cherry pecan bread. Prices aren't bad either.

Cafe Review

What a great place to eat in vegas.  You get to listen to the live performances while enjoying a fine italian bistro/fusion style dinner.  We ate an early dinner, around 5:15pm (we had a show at 7), and there was no wait.  In fact, it was pretty much empty except for a few diners.  Here's what we had for dinner:

1) Caeser salad (split): Pricey and small, but it was good.  Wolfgang sure knows how to pick out his cheeses.  The sliced parm on the salad was fantastic.  My gf usually doesn't like cheese and even she thought it was very tasty.
2) Pepporoni pizza: Pretty decent pizza.  Not the best I've ever had, but it was good.  Crust was baked thin and crispy, sauce wasn't overwhelming, pepporoni was tasty, and the sliced tomatoes were a nice touch.
3) Chocolate Souffle: This wasn't very good.  Though it only took 15 minutes to make, this quick rise souffle was waaay overcooked.  The vanilla bean sauce was good, but the souffle tasted like a chocalate cupcake.
4) Pitcher of sangria: Probably one of the best sangria's I've ever had...it was REALLY refreshing after a day of vegas.  The amount of sangria in the pitcher is perfect for two people.  The pitcher set me back $25, but this IS vegas afterall.  Filled about 6 wineglasses so it's actually not a bad deal.
*) Almost forgot to mention that they have a very tasty bread.  Loved the chewy texture.

I had a great experience here and will definitely return.  There's just something about sitting and eating under the venetian blue sky that soothes the mind.  I'd recommend the cafe sitting over the indoor restaurant.  While it looked nice inside, it didn't feel romantic.

If it wasn't for the souffle, this place would've recieved 5 stars.

Came here because we recieved a promo through the venetian where we stayed and it was an awesome lunch to have. The gf was treating me for my b day and this was a great way to start my b day considering I am a huge FOODIE.  we ordered some cesar salads but nothing special there. The lobster sandwhich on the other hand was something i would definitely go back for. Its really like eating a blt with lobster on 9 oat bread. GET it !! She had the burger nothing too special, but still nonetheless very good. Place is cool because we sat outside while they had some small band playing music on the violin.
Great broccoli soup! Grilled salmon over greens! Excellent service. The Restarant is inside the hotel but right off the Venetian canal giving sense of exterior European dining.

Before walking in, I was very against eating at this place. To me, it was just another overly-priced restaurant with lackluster food, but I was completely wrong. Yes it was a bit pricey, but the food was excellent. The Prime burger with the garlic aioli was absolutely delicious, as well as the Pink Lady Apple salad. Quite possibly the only salad that I've ever actually enjoyed. However what actually made me make an account and write this review is the service. Very kind and accomodating. I was eating someone with some dietary restrictions, and they were very helpful. Also they did take very long with our order due to some complications in the printing system. We hadn't even noticed, but they gave us two complimentary truffle chips and bleu cheese. Those too were phenomenal. I highly recommend this place.

Postrio is probably the 50 billionth Wolfgang Puck restaurant I've dined in but I have to say it has been my favorite. It is by far the best choice in the St. Mark's Square area of the Venetian. 

I was able to sample several of the dishes on my last trip to Vegas and the only disappointing part, as far as food is concerned, was the aioli that the pomme frites come with. I just wasn't into it. The shrimp cocktail was very filling, with incredibly jumbo shrimp, and a trip of dipping sauces. The pumpkin soup was fantastic, complete with pumpkin seeds. My husband ordered the fettuccine, which, despite what you may think is not in an alfredo sauce, and found it to be fantastic. I tried two of the salads (field greens and chef) and they were both very good and hearty enough to act as a lunch entree when paired with another appetizer or side. I loved the tapenade that came with the flatbread they serve to the table. 

They have a nice little wine by the glass list including a very good albarino. What I enjoyed the most was their diverse tea list. After selecting one I was most pleased to have the loose leaves steeped perfectly in a little cast iron tea pot delivered to my table. 

The one drawback here was service. During one of my lunch experiences here we waited nearly an hour for our food in a restaurant that was not very busy. However, slow service during lunch seems to be a hallmark of Wolfgang Puck restaurants so I should have known better.

I visited Wolfgang Buck's Postrio Bar & Grill for lunch and wanted a gourmet  soup and sandwich, and let us not forget dessert.

To start...  I read the menu online and had hoped to try the puree of sweet corn soup but the menu had changed.  I tried the pumpkin soup, as it is the holiday season, and I liked it.

Luckily, the lobster club sandwich I wanted to try wasn't left off the menu.  I take pleasure in trying a restaurant's twist on a classic, like the club, and the apple wood smoked bacon worked with nine grain bread but overwhelmed the lobster.  The classic or the twist?  It's a toss up.

To finish...  The meal ended a lot like it began, a changed up dessert menu, but I can't complain.  Not after eating an appetizing apple strudel coupled with pecan ice cream and a caramel.  Yum.  Yum.

Unfortunately, I was underwhelmed.  Yelp's reviews were up and down, but Wolfgang Buck's Cut and Spago in Los Angeles are amongst my favorite restaurants.  I'd happily eat here again, but I wouldn't walk up and down Las Vegas Blvd. to try some selections from their menu, which may or may not be there after I've arrived.

Everything is still a blur while my eyes are slowly adjusting to the daylight in the blue skies.  Where am I?  How did I get here?  Why can't I seem to remember much that happened to me before here, but somehow I have a strong feeling I need to be here to fulfill a promise... what? I don't know.

My senses... smell, touch, sound, sight... all coming to.  Where is this place?  This place seems so familiar to me, but I know it's not home.  Looks like a place I've seen somewhere in books, in pictures, on the internet at one point in time in my life.  I see lots of people and beautiful shops.  Many look like tourists.  I hear the voice of a tenor serenading... the soothing echoes of a language I can't seem to understand find me through this leisure crowd.  The overwhelmingly pleasant aroma of italian spices is making my stomach sing a very different song.  I need to get something to eat.  As I walk along shops of elegance and charm, I see a canal where boats carry lovers throughout this seemingly romantic place.  Ah yes... these boats... I know these boats.  They are gondolas!  Venice, Italy!  But how did I manage to get all the way here when I'm sure I was in the US last night?!?!  This is starting to scare me.  If I retrace to the last thing I remember, it would be.... Las Vegas.  I was in Las Vegas walking into a club.  Now I'm in Venice.  Everything in between... nothing.

I feel something in my pocket.  My phone is going off.  A text from my friend. 

Sonja: Are you here yet?  I'm hungry!  My break is only 45 mins!
Me: You're in Italy too?
Sonja: What are you talking about?  I thought we were doing lunch during my break?
Me: I don't know but I'm sure I'm in Venice right now because I see gondolas and I hear someone singing in Italian.
Sonja: OMG!  Quit messing around and hurry over to St. Mark's Square!  I'm here.
Me: I'm serious.
Sonja: Are you still drunk? You're not in Venice... You're at the Venetian... where I work... in Las Vegas... you drunkie!!!!!  
Me: Oh....... It all makes perfect sense now!  See you in 5 mins.

Hangover 4?  Nah.  It'd just be a blank script.  What this hungry dude needs is a good brunch to fill his blank inner canvas with flavor.  In matter of minutes, I found my friend arms crossed, tapping her toes, giving me that "fail" smirk right in the heart of St. Mark's Square... a beautiful open space where different restaurants are set up for outdoor dining indoors (was that an oxymoron?).  She says, "My lunch is short now because of you... let's go Postrio since it's quicker."

Service is amazingly friendly and welcoming.  To feed my hangover and empty belly, I order the Smoked Salmon Eggs Benedict w Crispy Seasoned Potatoes.  It's so good!  Eggs perfect with oozy yolks and the hollandaise has just the right touch to go with the toasted english muffin and savory smoked salmon.  Potatoes are so nice and crispy with a very appetizing seasoning.  I see chicken apple sausage and have to add that to the side.  Get it.  Juicy bites of sweet n savory sausage makes the perfect addition to an all American meal.  I'm stuffed.  

In my confused state of existence, I couldn't ask for a better brunch... familiar and American, in an Italian setting, below gorgeous weather, where gondolas float, love birds cuddle, tenors serenade, and hungover people grub.  Ok... person.  I think I was the only one there hungover.  

Remember.  You are at the Postrio... Here at St. Mark's Square, Venetian, Las Vegas, Nevada, USA.  Not Italy.
I was here for lunch.  My group all ordered pizzas and split them.  The food was creative and delicious, even for this avowed pizza snob from New York City.  Well done.

I remember going there awhile ago in 2007.  They charge to share plates.  Lamb was excellent.  Probably favorite Wolfgang Puck Restaurant so far, not  much of a fan of the others.

Environment:  Inside Venetian Hotel.  Middle area of all restaurants & shopping area.  Nice, so dress nice.

Recommendation:  Sit in Patio area to hear the musicians play in the middle court.

Postrio is one of many Wolfgang Puck restaurants in Vegas.  I read somewhere that Puck has single-handedly put Vegas on the map as a culinary destination.  Back in the day (before my time), Vegas was home to $1.99 pancake breakfasts with a slice of ham steak and two eggs any style and all-you-can-eat buffets comprised of questionable food stuffs.  Now, you will find so many top chefs have taken a gamble (no pun intended) and opened high-caliber restaurants thus further raising the bar for newcomers.  

Postrio has two separate dining areas with corresponding menus, the "outdoor" and indoor areas.  We chose the outdoor seating because we were accompanied by my darling two year old nephew. 

I order a small plate of heirloom melon with prosciutto, figs and a cheese filled cookie/cracker sweetened by honey.  It was delicous.  All of the flavors blended seamlessly.  The only thing that irritated me a bit was the fact that the servers brought my salad/small plate at the same time they served my entree.  Personally I prefer my salad as a first course then the entree.  But the taste of the item (delish) made up for the weird timing.

My dad and I were still pretty full from lunch so we split the margherita pizza.  Since Wolfgang Puck is synonymous with pizza, it was a must try.  Very tasty.  For dessert we all split this really yummy strawberry cream puff pie.  OMG so yummy!  Postrio's is a nice place if you want to have a relatively quick, but tasty bite of food.

My mom and I came here becuase we received a 20% off coupon for staying at the Palazzo, so we figured it would be nice to go to a nice dinner.  The places was just OK. The service wasn't that great! After several requests it took them about 15 min for our drinks and some bread.   I order the hamburger which was ok and my mom ordered the Halibut which looked good but was dry.  It was not worth the $100 we spent there.  There are  better places in vegas and I would not come back here.
Omg!!!! His dishes are unbelievable. Sooo good!!!!! Im hooked after eating here i didnt want to eat anywhere else lmao!!! :( i have to buy wolf gangs cook book.

Went here for lunch, and had a great meal.  Both of us had the chopped salad, but ordered it with salmon instead of the shrimp listed on the menu.  The server was more than happy to accommodate our request for the substitution.  The salmon was cooked perfectly.  Nice little spot to go for lunch, as it is in the middle of the Venetian Canal Shops with entertaining floor shows nearby.  If you can find a spot to sit on the "outside" (it's really in the mall, but outside the main restaurant), the people-watching is a blast.

I like this place a lot. It is in a random and busy area, where a lot of people are walking around and gawking at performers, but if you can zone that all out or sit towards the inside, it's a delightful place to eat.

Our waiter was fast, and nice. He was quick, and really nice. Not particularly memorable, but he does his job and he does it just fine. The cups, dishes, and silverware were all really cute. When I see a table set well, I can really appreciate it! Everything was well thought out--the geometrical shapes of everything, the colors...it was just really pleasant to look at.

The food was interesting. There were very unique dishes. We ordered an appetizer of the three sausages with mustard, and they were amazing. Each sausage had a different flavor, and I believe two of them were filled with pistachios. I'd never had that before, but I have to say I loved it. The three different types of mustard and three different types of sausage sure as heck wasn't boring. Lots of experimentation occurred, and we even discussed which pairings we liked the best. My actual entree was a pizza topped with pesto and shrimp. It was pretty good, but the pesto shrimp got a little too salty. I still enjoyed the appetizer more than i did the entree, which would have been the only reason why I gave this place 3 stars instead of 4.

Great food. TERRIBLE service.  At these prices, you would expect guests in a half full restaurant to have fast, friendly service.  No way. We had to ask for drinks, then bread, then menus, and at the end, even the check

Don't waste a meal on  this  place (unless you're a masochist).  There are plenty of others in Sin City.

I visited Postrio with a friend on Tuesday night and had a very good experience.  The service was outstanding, the atmosphere was elegant without being stuffy and the wine selection had a very nice range of types and prices.  My friend and I both started with the vegetable terrine and it was delicious!  For our entree I had the duck and she had the bouillabaisse seafood dish.  The duck was good, but I have had better, perfectly tender but lacking a bit in flavor.  The seafood dish was flavorful and very fresh.  For dessert we had the creme brulee and the cheese plate.  Each were good, but not outstanding.  

Our server, I think his name was Mark, was friendly, informative and gave us a lot of attention without harrassing us.  Perfectly balanced.

I would go back and try other items on the menu because overall it was a very enjoyable experience.

The food here is always GREAT! This time, my the number of people in my party was 7 for lunch which forced us outside the normal enclosed dining area. Being outside the area, it was more difficult to get the same attention if we were inside the boundaries.
I realize the lunch period is always busy but this lunch took over 90 minutes which caused our customer to have to leave as soon as they were done eating.
I will eat here again but with a smaller party next time so we can be seated inside their eating area and not near the resort entertainment attraction.

This restaurant never disappoints!  Whenever we visit Las Vegas we always eat here and it's always so good!  This time with the  basket of bread (baguette, focaccia and olive bread) we started off with a glass of good wine, Pinot Noir Inception.  Then the calamari appetizer, the batter is so light an airy like tempura!  Yum!  We then had a nashi pear salad.  We were pleased that the kitchen split the salad for us.  The pears were julienned, sweet and juicy on a bed of fresh spring greens with pomegranate, bleu cheese and candied pecans with a light vinaigrette dressing.  So good!   We then shared a margherita pizza which was delicious!  Just loved the thin tender crust. Too bad we were too full to try dessert this time.  Would have loved to try the beignets with a cappuccino.  Our server, Ricardo was so friendly and very helpful in answering our questions.  So nice to be treated like our business mattered unlike Otto across the way.  We will be returning for sure!
"Linguine was pretty tasty..."

Location: nice outside seatings that you can enjoy the venetian show
Price: decent 
Food: just ok, nothing special to write about.  I ordered the chicken soup with celery.  It was a little bit salty for my taste and I did expect something better from a world class chef's restaurant.  All other dishes ordered by my friends were just average as well.  There are better restaurants to try in Vegas than Postrio.

Hmm, not overly impressed. My husband and I stopped here for a late lunch. While the location is pretty cool (and awesome for people watching!) and the food okay, it was the service that left us feeling quite negatively towards the restaurant. 

The hostess was cold almost to the point of being rude, and our waitress was also quite cold and inattentive. It was between 3 and 4 PM, so the restaurant was only about 1/3rd full, yet my water was not refilled once during the meal. After we received our food, we were not checked on at all until it was time to clear the plates. 

We both ordered a pizza, which was pretty good, but nothing amazing. The portion sizes for the pizza are quite large, and we were both able to take home two good sized slices for a snack later. 

A very mediocre experience. I don't think we will return.

The only thing you need to order is their Margherita pizza! It's the best pizza you will ever have! Even a meat lover would enjoy this veggie pizza! 

If you must eat here, make sure you eat in the patio seating area so you can watch the canal's entertainment. It is a bit loud, but it's great awesome food with entertainment! 

Our server was pretty awesome as well. He went along with the jokes we were throwing out at him. Though I can't say the same for the busboy. Don't think he spoke very much english either. But that doesn't really matter when our real server was on point with refilling our beverages and making sure we were okay. He was a funny guy. Felt like we were just hanging out with someone that we knew for quite some time. 

This place is a bit pricey, but well worth the money! Their presentation is very modern and a little upscale in comparison to your ruby tuesdays, it is wolfgang puck after all! I would definitely come by here again, just for their pizza!

Quite possibly the bestest chicken parmesan i have ever had the pleasure of eating. 

It was pricy at 25 bucks, but worth every piece!

Served with delicious garlic bread and a balsamic green salad.

They took absolutely forever to bring our food, which was very problematic because we had not eaten in a LONG time and we were hungover and cranky after a night of partying.

Everyone else seemed pleased with their food.
I will definitely return, if only for that delicious chicken parmesan.

Wolfgang puck knows hot to please me!

We had a late lunch here.  Food was good and pretty typical Wolfgang Puck fare.  We split a salad and a pizza.  Service was painfully slow and it took forever to get our food-- even at a time when it wasn't that busy.   We ate "outside" and enjoyed watching a Venetian show as we ate.

The only reason I gave this place 2 stars instead of 1 is because the food wasn't all that bad...wasn't great, but wasn't bad.

Let me start off by saying that if there is a restaurant that you won't even return to if it was free, then you know it was a horrible experience.  That's been the situation twice for us.

We go to Vegas at least 5 times a year and because of the fact that I'm an avid gambler, our room at the Venetian is always comped.  Along with that comp comes a food credit to Postrio, so our meals are basically free here.

The first time we went there, the hostess was so snobby...she won't say a word until you ask for her assistance.  As a matter of fact she'll just stare at your face without saying anything and won't look away until you say "hi" or "for 2 please".  Servers, almost the same attitude.  We asked for bread and butter before the meal, as anybody would expect at a semi-steakhouse, and they said "no" at first, followed by "fine, but we usually don't give out bread and butter as we have to bake the bread first".  I'm not kidding, that's what she said.  It was the same the second time we went there, if not worse.

The courses are pretty good but the service is such a turnoff that even if the meals were free I wouldn't eat here...and for me the meals are free.
Had lunch here. Portions were larger than I expected. The pasta was delicious. We sat in the courtyard area of the Venetian. The street performers were out and singing, which was a bit noisy.

If there is one thing I despise in a server, it is defensiveness rather than service. I try to avoid carbs, and therefore asked for asparagus instead of potatoes with my halibut...just as my husband did. While my husband received a lovely portion of asparagus, I received three "flecks" and I do mean flecks of asparagus embedded in the creamy corn stuff my fish was on. When I inquired as to the whereabouts of the substituted asparagus, the first words out if the waiters mouth were "I don't control the portions." Next "did you want me to get you some more?" As though I were imposing on him with my question. All in all my halibut was flavorless and the service was disappointing. I expect more from a Wolfgang Puck eatery. Boo.

This is based on the cafe experience more so than the restaurant.  The menu for the cafe seemed a lot more appetizing than the regular menu so we decided to give it a shot.  Besides that, it was outdoor-cafe like seating (well it's in the Venetian, so it's more pseudo-outdoor).  

The sausage platter for starters was fabulous.  It had three different types, a chicken w/ sun dried tomatoes, a pistachio with pepper, and a smoked garlic apple.  it also included three mustard to compliment them as well.  The sweet apricot mustard was intoxicating and blended well with all the meats.  The standard Dijon and ale mustard's were quite bold and went well with all as well.

The halibut was extremely buttery and tender.  The vinaigrette and condiments that came with it truly was a great mixture of flavors.  And the Pork Wierneschznitzel was extremely good as well.  It was buttered  and seasoned to perfections with a perfectly baked panko crumb crust.

The service was great and the prices weren't astronomical to break the bank either.  Plus you don't have to wait forever like the restaurant section, and the serving portions are very generous.

We were seated right away with a great view to people watch. 
They brought out pita bread pieces with hummus and another sauce. Yum! ....we ended up asking for more. 

I had the Cesar salad, which gets 2 stars. I didn't care for the dressing and anchovies are just not my thing. 
I then had the sausage and peppers. There are 3 different types of sausages and 3 different types of spreads. Very good.

I can't RAVE about this place because nothing gave me that WOW factor. ...but all in all it was good.

This is probably my favorite Italian place I have ever tried. Every time I go to Vegas I always go and eat here. I have never been disappointed in the food and I've tried a wide variety of it. They make their pasta homemade and the price isn't too bad, especially for Vegas. The meat is always cooked perfectly and their sauces are to die for. Overall I would suggest going here whenever you have a chance.

Great restaurant in SF and in Las Vegas. We had the crab cakes and the sausage sampler plate to begin. The homemade sausages with the three mustards were excellent. The crab cake was good too. We then tried the black angus burger that had a lot of seasoning on it and was ok. As were the gnocchi and ravioli.  However the pizza was excellent.  The fourth star came because of the chocolate beignets with caramel sauce and chocolate malt ice cream. It was excellent.

Went to this restaurant memorial day weekend, service was good but thats about it.  The food took a long time and when it finally came out it was mediocre.  I was dissapointed, I expected a little better from this celebrity chef.  i wont return.  Not work my money, Otto is directly accross and is much better.  I will not return.

Dined here this past Saturday and the food was sooo good we had to come back for more. Hubby and I had the calamari and shrimp with sweet chili sauce was perfectly crisp. The chili sauce was a great accompaniment. Hubby ordered the lasagna and I had the linguine with clam sauce. Both were wonderful. You taste the freshness in the ingredients. 
The following night we came here for my birthday and sadly because we didn't make reservations, they didn't have seating available. Lucky for us!!! We wound up sitting where we had the best service during our entire stay in Vegas, including dining at CraftSteak which was terrible. Anyhew, our bartender Min was on top of everything. The food was again fantastic!! We had the calamari again and it was consistently good. For dinner hubby had the spaghettini with meatballs and I had the mushroom ravioli. Again, fantastic!! You seriously can taste the freshness of the pasta and other ingredients. 
For dessert we had the Smore Pie at the recommendation of Min. Again, another winner. We will absolutely be back and happily sit at the bar where you get the best service as well as great food. You can't beat that in Vegas. 
I almost forgot, the price is VERY reasonable compared to other restaurants in Vegas. Earlier this week had dinner at CraftSteak, paid over $100 more for lesser quality food and service. At Postrio we paid less and got soo much more in terms of quality and service. I can't wait to come back.

Very nice pre-show dinner at Postrio. 
The tuna tartare was perhaps the culinary highlight of my trip to Vegas. 
Just the right amount of kick balanced by the avacado.  The short rib ravioli were very good, but just a bit too "herby" for my taste.  
If I go again I'll sit inside as the square can get a bit loud.

Starters:
Greek Salad, Feta Cheese, Olives
Salt & Pepper Calamari
Trio of House-made Sausages, Three Mustards

The three starters that I shared with a few friends were all pretty standard. The calamari was cooked perfectly. But the standout is definitely the house-made sausages with the different mustards. Pretty yummy!

Main Course:
Steamed Black Mussels in White Wine Garlic Broth, Grilled Sourdough with Béarnaise Sauce

The mussels were plump, fresh, and cooked perfectly. The white wine, garlic broth was good. It would have been perfect to sop the sourdough into the broth, but unfortunately they smothered the bread with béarnaise sauce, which I didn't care much for.

Desserts:
Chocolate Beignets, Caramel Macchiato Ice Cream
Bourbon-Peach Bread Pudding, Butter-Pecan Ice Cream

Our waitress selected the two desserts for our table as a birthday celebration for my friend. I dipped a beignet into the vanilla sauce, topped it with a spoonful of caramel macchiato ice cream, and then ate the whole thing in one bite. It was good with the liquid center. Not too rich or heavy.

Overall, our meal at Postrio was A-OK and pretty standard. Nothing particularly new or outstanding in terms of flavor, but everything was seasoned well and cooked perfectly. We chose to sit "outside" at St. Mark's Square and while we had to endure groups of tourists gawking at us, we also got to enjoy a beautiful, live performance by The Venetian Trio throughout our entire dinner. And it was quite cute that there was a lone pigeon walking around on the fake cobblestone.

As an apology for forgetting one of the main course orders at our table, they comped a $20 "birthday celebration" fee, so that was a nice gesture. But wow, do they really charge $20 to write happy birthday in chocolate on a dessert plate?

Had lunch here when in Vegas for a conference.  More like a 3.5.  After watching Wolfgang Puck berate a Food Network Star contestant for her attempt at gnocci, I had to give it a try.  It was tasty, the tomato sauce with finely chopped Italian sausage was perfect with the ricotta. It was, however, served alone on a plate much larger than the portion, and I couldn't help but notice that the next table over was given a plate of bread with their pasta dishes.

I had dinner on a previous night at Maggiano's, and while I like to explore beyond chain restaurants, I have to say the dinner there was tastier, larger portion size (I ate part of it for breakfast the next morning), much more attentive service (& all the bread we would have asked for), and it cost less.  If you're looking to try "celebrity chef" food, it's OK, nothing was wrong with it, but I probably wouldn't go back.

My husband & I had our wedding reception here and it was just PERFECT! Everyone & everything from the food, kitchen staff, front of the house, wait staff & manager Randy were all superb!! They were all professional and assured all of our guests were taken care of. I highly recommend this restaurant & the private rooms if you want an intimate party or wedding. I come to Vegas a few times a year and I can't wait to go back and just dine here!!!

Lovely meal after a very long day. Restaurant was packed.  We had a reservation and were seated promptly. Friendly server and great service throughout meal. 

Caesar salad was perfect with white anchovies. Not too dressed and crispy lettuce. Chicken Milanese was best ever. Really crispy with fresh arugula and spectacular tomatoes. Nice wine list by glass. Bread was yummy too. Too full for dessert. Next time. 

Small space with all tables filled but you didn't feel crowded. Out in open @ Venetian with a quartet playing in background.

For all these years, I have been quite put off by Wolfgang Puck's places in airports and others, still learning that his name is more unique to me than his menu and dining experience. The food simply was not any better than pub foods, or a frozen meal. Nothing he should be too proud of.

However, we ran into this place purely by accident, walking into the Venetian hotel. Dining experience at Postrio definitely made me change my harsh perception for him too the neutral.

Hearty portion of meals, served with good and reasonably priced wine and beer selections. The food tastes finally better than what I had experienced in other places with the lame, banal, not so fresh pretentious kind,. 

At Postrio, the plates we ordered were fresh and with very simple and inexpensive ingredients, it was intepreted as something better in my mouth. I, still, would not call Postrio, a gourmet restaurant, yet. But, its simple but very enjoyable dinner experience definitely deserve 4-5 stars. I still give harsh 4. blaming the food menu is a Bistro kind, and still has a room to improve in menu board.

The friendly and very professional waiters are definitely team workers. That adds extra star.

Very casual restaurant. I had the scallops and they were okay. Not the best, but not the worst. Service was decent and everything ordered here was decent. Being a restaurant in Las Vegas though, I think needs to be more then decent to have returning customers IMO. 

On to the next restaurant.

Great location inside the Canal Shoppes but a little on the pricey side.  I got a salad with a side of chicken (though they do give a lot of chicken on the side) that was good but I'm not sure I would have gotten that had I paid for myself.  The mint/ginger lemonade was disappointing.  

Also, if the opera singers in the square are at it, very difficult to hear if you're seated "outside."

Very impressed. The service was excellent, the food was delicious, and the atmosphere was fun yet elegant. 

My husband treated me for a pre-birthday dinner while visiting Vegas this past weekend and he picked Postrio. I like Wolfgang Puck though sometimes he's a bit overrated. Postrio however, did not disappoint. 

I had a lovely glass of prosecco and we enjoyed the trio of housemade sausages for an appetizer. My husband had the spaghetti and meatballs and I enjoyed the meatloaf. We were both impressed with the bread selection and thought the foccocia was the most delicious we'd ever tasted. For dessert we shared the Banoffee which was a banana cream pie with toffee sauce. It was amazing! 

Definitely ask for a table inside if you don't want the hustle and bustle of the Venetian to intrude on your dining experience. It's much quieter inside and more appropriate for an intimate dinner for two.

I kept hearing about these wonderful restaurants of world class chefs, so we decided to check Postrio by WOlfgang Puck....
THe prices are steep, however I figured the food would be worth it.
It wasn't....the dish I ordered was worse than the teriyaki I get at a local strip mall for 5 bucks. Extremely over-sauced to the extend that I had to continually wash it down with water. Even a few hours later I still had the aftertaste in my mouth. Service was adequate and location is not bad, but
I am completely serious, please, look elsewhere if you actually want to taste quality food !

We did not have reservations on a busy Friday night but we were accommodated and seated within five minutes.

We had the steak dish which included succulent potatoes.  

Their calamari was possibly the best I've ever had and it was well accompanied by some añejo Don Julio.

I will definitely go back to this place.

One of the best lunches we had on our recent visit to Las Vegas was here at Postrio.  Good food, excellent service, and a really nice environment.  We had a couple of different pizzas and a couple of different sandwiches.  All were shared and all were equally enjoyed.  How could it get much better?

Service was excellent.  Dignified but not snooty.  The water boy even "blocked" teh glass with anapkin when he poured to ensure not to splash on the food.  What nice touch!

I graded a bit harshly (and feel a little bit embarassed to do so), giving only four stars, because one of the white napkins set at our table had a very visible smear of tomato sauce.  Although that situation was discretely corrected within 2.68 seconds of bringing it to their attention, I would have expected the bus staff to have seen that when setting up the table.

Many thanks to Chef Wolfgang Puck and his staff!

EDIT:  Y'know, folks... we has such a good time, and good food, and good service that deducting a star for a soiled napkin seems rediculous -- even to me, who can be a highly over critical reviewer at times.  I changed the stars to FIVE.  I can't get this place off of my mind... which is one of the criteria I have for giving "Woo hoo's".

Daniel, our server, was excellent!   My drink was always full, made good recommendations, was personable and fun!  Got to watch the show in St Mark's square and the pizza and butternut squash dish were to die for!  Great find in vegas!

In Vegas for 4 days, ate here twice. Service was a little slow but for the food, it was definitely worth the wait. Also, it was a nice location to people watch and be watched if that's something you're interested in.

Pizza is a must try. Good balance of ingredients and the crust was amazing when it was hot. I love bacon so I had to add it on and ohhhgoodness it was good bacon.

According to my mother, the burger is a must try. It's actually what led us to try Postrio. We saw a picture of it on one of their ads and she had to have it. I mean, she figured if Wolfgang Puck's canned soup was good, his restaurant had to be worth trying! It definitely was.

Last thing, their fries. Order them. Skinny and crunchy but one of the few places that aren't oily! We didn't wipe our hands off once because there was no oil on our fingers and we didn't want to stop eating the fries!

Unfortunately we didn't try their dessert but from the looks of the ones we saw around us, it doesn't look like you could go wrong.

Don't let those 20-25% off coupons trick you into going to Postrio. It lured me in (my Asian cheapness came out) and it was not worth it.  The faux-outdoor seating is charming and the free bread is good but the positives stop right there. 

The $18 pizza was very average. The $26 short-rib ravioli was less than average. I would have preferred Olive Garden's short-rib tortellini to the four chewy and stringy ravioli at this Wolfgang Puck restaurant.  

The  restaurant's Piazza San Marcos location reminds me of the real Piazza San Marcos - a tourist trap filled with overpriced mediocre restaurants.

Our favorite restaurant in the Venetian/Palazzo.  Attentive service and top notch food.  You can be seated outdoors (actually it's indoors in the Vegas version of St. Mark's Square,  minus the Italian pigeons), and  great Renaissance entertainment while you dine.  We had the Pink Lady apple salad, a favorite.  Sea bass well prepared.  We took our daughter for the first time, and she was impressed.  
Make reservations if possible, and sit in the outdoor patio area.  Nightly shows throughout dinner are a big bonus.  Leave room for the dessert platter of cookies.

Seems like many reviews are complaining about the price, so let me start with this:

Uh YEAH, you are in a world class chef's restaurant in LAS VEGAS.  It's going to be pricey!

Having said that, I thought it was excellent all the way around.  

We went late, about 9:30pm after the Phantom show.   Plenty of seating available, we had a reservation but didn't really need one for the dining room.  Patio area was full and I do not think you can reserve that.

Service was outstanding.  Yes, the food takes a bit of time, but again, you are in a world class chefs house, not Chili's!

I had the free-range chicken which was beautifully cooked.  Everything on the plate was great from the chicken to the veggies.   And I will add, for being "pricey" the portion size was great, a full half chicken and a full plate of garnish and potato.  Sometimes at this type of place you expect a $30 chicken dish to be about 3 ounces of meat and a handful of carrots...not here!

Last time in LV I went to one of Puck's other spots, in Caesars I think but not for sure on the location, and it was not good.   I was a bit hesitant, but wanted to eat in the same place we were seeing the show.   I was not disappointed this time.  Highly recommend!

It's inside the Venetian.  It's part of the Wolfgang Puck chain.  It's 25% more than a similar meal off the strip.  That being a given the service was excellent even though they were packed at lunch.  The roasted turkey on sourdough with chips was very good.  I also had a beer that at $8 was a bit over priced anywhere off the strip.  I had a seat with great people watching.  Normally I avoid strip places just because of the value factor but I would definitely lunch here again.  Interestingly what drew me in was the corned beef Reuben but I changed my mind based on I prefer sourdough to rye.

After roaming thru the "Grand Canal Shoppes" at the Venetian, and visiting Davidoff's to pick up a few cigars, I arrived at postrio.

I initially walked away as the hostess was too engulfed in a conversation about herself with one of her colleagues. Taking a few steps towards my exit, I returned and interrupted the bloviation to be seated at the bar. Fortunately, the bartender/server (Erica) was spectacular - attentive, down-to-earth and very charming. Reviewing the lunch menu, I asked for her recommendation ... the Lobster Club. WOW! it was mouth watering to say the least. To end the meal, Erica suggested the Key Lime or the Chocolate beignets w/liquid center and macchiato ice cream; I had the latter and it was heavenly! Next time I'll have a glass of cab with the beignets instead of a double expresso.

Lunch was so good that I had to come back two days later for the lobster club before returning to SF.

Colleague's friend raved about this place so we made reservations for a party of 5 to try this place out. It was packed on the "outdoor" seating area so we sat inside. Service was tremendously slow, is this Vegas type of deal? All these supposedly fancy and upmarket restaurants have mediocre food and super slow service for some odd reason! I had the seafood boulabaisse which was ordinary, certainly not wow, was kinda similar to other ordinary Italian places that I've been too. It wasn't bad but it certainly wasn't off the wall good!
Colleagues said their ahi tuna dishes were moderate but supposedly the steak was not to be missed.

I had to leave early for the Cirque show at Treasure Island so apparently, I missed out on a good chocolate dessert. I've tried other Wolfgang's restaurants but this did not stand out.

The tuna tartare was absolutely amazing. As soon as we saw it on the menu, all other dinner options went out the window. The food was lovely, the wine was great, the service was attentive but not over bearing. Fantastic way to spend a dinner in Vegas. Well done.

Beautiful St Mark's Square is located inside the sumptuous Venetian hotel.  It is designed to simulate an outdoor venue and with its high domed ceiling, faux sky, and special-effects lighting, it succeeds very well.  On the perimeter are shops and restaurants, the latter with "alfresco" patios, including the Postrio Bar & Grill, which augments the open-air feeling. 

My wife and I stopped in the Postrio Bar & Grill with a friend before our 7:00 p.m. theater show in the hotel.  We wanted a drink and something light to eat, so we sat at the bar and had small plates of the house-made meatballs with tomato sauce and grilled beef skewers with steak sauce.  The food was delicious and the perfect amount.  The drinks were well made, the service friendly and professional, and the cost reasonable.  In addition, we had a good view of the entertaining and professional Carnivale show performed in the square. 

The Postrio Bar & Grill is highly recommended for its food, service, and ambiance as well as its location.

So I've never been a big fan of the Wolfgang and a lot of these celebrity chefs more because I believe they over commercialized themselves, but more power to them, I certainly respect them for getting to the top of their game.

That said, to get to the top of your game you have to know your craft and deliver the goods, which I find he does whenever I go to one of his restaurants and tonight was no exception.

I get that Vegas is what it is and appreciate that no where does it better.
