Contrary to other reviewers, I actually ended up with great service. The server was attentive, all I had to do was look at her and she came over. Drinks were never left empty, and silverware was replaced between courses. They even brought each dish out split onto two plates without us having to ask.

The crab cakes were light and fresh, and the creative mix of greens went well with them. The mushroom and leak pizza was good, a little on the salty/oily side but not overdone on the cheese, with a crispy yet light crust. The spring pea angolotti with pea shoots and maitake mushrooms was the highlight, the fresh peas were smoothly textured, the mushrooms added great flavor, great early summer meal. 

The only downside that really stood out to me is the general atmosphere of the faux Italian piazza, but that affects all the restaurants in the area. The Venetian should really invest in improving the acoustics, it gets really loud and hard to hear the person across from you.

Short ribs 80 percent fat. Salmon under cooked. Vegetables with the salmon were greasier then the fries. Caesar salad had too much dressing. A heavy hand in general. Drinks took too long to come. Not what I would have expected from a Wolfgang Puck. They did remove the salmon from the bill and give a free plate of cookies that tastes good.

The worst restaurant experience I've had in Vegas.  I was a big fan of Postrio, and made it a point to take customers there every year during CES (Consumer Electronics Show).  This year, however, I noticed their service has dropped off a cliff.  they didn't have our table at the time of our reservation, so we waited an extra 20 minutes.  The waiter was practically non-existent, and because we had seven people in our party, they applied an automatic gratuity of 18%, regardless of the poor service.  I can only assume that b/c the gratuity was guaranteed, they focused on smaller parties for which the tip isn't predetermined.  Anyway, I'm not going to risk taking customers to Postrio in the future, and would not recommend this restaurant....there are too many other good places to go...

I didn't know what to expect from Postrio, but was very pleased with my first meal here.  My party of four was seated in a booth in the main dining room after my party of four arrived five minutes before our 7:00 p.m. reservation and announced our presence.  After a few slices of good bread and butter, We began with a Jumbo Shrimp Cocktail and Spicy Tuna Tartare.  The Shrimp Cocktail was really unusual looking.  Six long and mostly straight shrimps lay on the plate, heads and all.  We cut off the heads, and then found that the cold shrimp meat was just as tasty dipped in a horseradish-based Cocktail Sauce as the more common curved variety.  These specimens were neither rubbery nor tough, and six of them was a generous serving.  The Tuna Tartare, with avocado, pickled ginger, cucumber, and crisp wontons, was just mildly spicy, moist, refreshingly cool, and delicious.

Next was one of the best Margarita Pizzas I have ever eaten.  It was orange topped with six red tomato slices evenly spread  around the circumference, with Mozzarella Cheese nicely melted over each slice of tomato, fresh basil haphazardly resting in place, on a crust that was supple but perfectly baked.  The outer rim looked hard but wasn't.  Slices were juicy, finished with San Marzano Tomato Sauce.  Our appetizer pizza was dispatched quite quickly; it could have served as a nice entree.  Later, when walking out of the restaurant, I saw two more Margarita Pizzas that looked just like ours, so there appears to me consistency in food preparation.

Home Style Chicken Soup was chock-full of cut vegetables and hunks of tender white chicken meat, and tasted great.  Caesar Salad was all good, with a spicy and creamy Caesar dressing, except a single anchovy was rather flat and pretty tasteless.  Clam Chowder with a few Parmesan crackers floating on top was a little rough: somewhat smokey and spicy in flavor, with undressed chunks of clams inside as if just plucked out of their shells.

Pancetta Wrapped Meatloaf with Mushroom Gravy, resting on a bed of Yukon Gold Potato Puree, with three buttermilk-battered Onion Rings on top, was really dense but very tasty--great comfort food!  A side of buttered Buttered Brussels Sprouts was okay, while multi-hued Cauliflower was visually appealing and nicely cooked--not too hard and not too soft.  The heads were orange, green, white, and black.  

 A Banoffee--Banana & Toffee Cream Pie--made with House-Made Toffee and Banana Cream in a Sugar Dough Shell with a thick crust, was a unique, cool and refreshing dessert.  Banana lovers will really like this dish, that includes a small pitcher of Toffee Syrup to pour over the large slice of pie as much as one desires.  Iced Tea was good and tasty, and a non-alcoholic Mint Iced Tea was even more refreshing.  

Service was excellent except that I had to request one Iced Tea refill, and two serving spoons for the sides.  Diane was accommodated by a requested substitution of very good Roasted Potatoes for Austrian Potatoes, and Buerre Blanc for a Mustard-based sauce.  In fact, I was leaning toward an award of five stars until the day after we dined there, when I was contacted by Open Table via email that the restaurant had reported my party as a "no show."  It was aggravating to have to prove that we were there after spending about $300 on dinner for four, but it was easy to do since our server had presented me with his card.  But the restaurant should perform better checking off of honored reservations than this, so 1/2 a star was lost for this irritating mistake.  But, overall, this was still a very enjoyable dining experience, and I plan to return soon to sample other intriguing offerings.

4-1/2 stars on this initial outing!
Tasty lamb sandwich for lunch. That's about it. Simple lunch, simple food, nothing memorable.

Amazing! Having been to many italian restaurants i can say that Postrio has some of the best pasta around. I had the spaghettini with tomato and it was great as was the caesar salad. The spaghettini was clearly fresh and not boxed and the sauce was amazing. I'm not one who usually eats tomatoes out of the sauce but I cleaned my plate and had the tomatoes that were left over when all the pasta was done. The caesar salad dressing was perfect and much larger than I had anticipated. It is actually a great deal considering it's location, portion size and food quality. Next time I'm in Vegas I'll definitely be coming back and will be making a beeline straight to Fake Saint Marks square to Postrio.

I was just here this weekend.  Service was great and the waiters were attentive and polite.  However, the food seems to be a hit or miss for the price.  For example, the salmon was great, but the thirty-something dollar flat iron was okay.  The beef skewers were also disappointing for the price as they were a bit dry.  Skip that and shoot for the Calamari, scallop, and shrimp appetizer.

I'd been here a few times.  I love where it's located in the Madison Square.  I love eating and people watching.  The food is always great and the service is always topnotch.

We had the Sausage Pizza and the homemade spaghetti. It was one of the best I have ever had.

3.5 Stars.

Ordered an Arnold Palmer -- the glass was NEVER empty.  They refilled/replaced it when I was only half done (ice melted too much?) Excellent service!!!

The beet salad had really good beets but really salty salad.  

The bread served in paper bag ~ cute!!

Only one in our part ordered an appetizer, but they made the rest of us wait through his eating it (instead of asking us if we want to order some food for the rest of the table or asking us when we want to be served).  So, we ended up all staring at him while he ate his soup.

The mushroom pizza was good, but the lobster sandwich was not as impressive as a good old New England lobster roll and the salads apparently were just, plain (according to those who ordered it).

I'd go again cuz it's fun hanging out in the plaza and see the acts, plus, you can be there all day with the non-stop Arnold Palmer!

Had a large group for lunch yesterday.  Clients, so wanted to make sure I found a good spot.  Postrio does not disappoint.  Great food.  Atmosphere in the restaurant is relaxed.  The only complain I would have is the service.  The waiters kept forgetting things and we had to constantly remind them for items we had asked for.  That would be my only complaint.  Way too many servers and hostesses wandering around trying to look busy, but not really doing anything.  I would definitely recommend this place though.
Amazing place to dine, food and service where outstanding. I don't think I agree with the $$ price listed here but I think the pricing was defiantly in-line with the high quality service and food.

I will not be visiting this place again.

It wasn't the food, not at all. I was pleased with my lasagna.
The service was terrible. My friends and I had made 8:15 reservations, we weren't seated til 8:45. It took another 20 minutes to get a glass of water and menus, another 30 for the damn waiter to come back. One of our water runners wasn't wearing his tie clip, his tie was touching and hanging around all over our glasses. 

I could go on, but you get the picture right? Save your money for a meal somewhere else.

Wolfgang is one of my favorite mainstream chefs.  I'm in love with his style of cooking, overall restaurant decor and lack of stuffiness.

The food was amazing.  We got a bottle of wine and shared the raviolis and Lobster BLT.  The portions were off, the ravioli dish was on the dainty side and the sandwich was massive and enough to feed two.  No big deal, but the price didn't justify the vast size difference.  OMG - let's not forget the delicious fries.  They were so good, the idea of ketchup scared me.  

Although a little gaudy (but hey, isn't that Vegas) it was really fun to sit inside/outside.  I felt I was in a cartoon sitting in the palazzio of Venice.     The host and service was great with us; I was debating between the lobster BLT and linguini and clams and with conviction, "hands down the BLT."  She was NOT wrong there!

I struggled with this rating.
We were told that we could sit at the bar if we wanted to sit soon and being that we had gondola tickets in 80 minutes and hunger right then and there, we chose the bar.  We were told it would be the same menu.  We are seated in what would be a very nice booth anywhere else but here they refer to it as sitting at the bar becuase its not at the main restaurant.  We are given the Cafe Menu.  I ask for the Tasting Menu and the waiter goes into this whole long song and dance about how there are two different menus and two different chefs and his chef will say no.  At this table with me is a waitress at another 4 star Vegas restaurant who totally joins me in making fun of this fool who just bascially told us we cant spend $100 a person here because we are seated on the other side of a halfwall and we can only spend a total of $100 for 3 people.  This weird waiter must work for some other reason then tips.  
In the end however, the food won out.  
The "Liquid therapy" menu hit the right spot with a "Flirtini" but not so much with the Mango Martini.  The bread served in a bag with some of the creamiest butter was simply heaven.  
The dishes were served with excellent presentation.
As they were laid out on the table, quirky waiter returns with gusto asking how everything is. Um, buddy no one has tasted anything yet.
He comes back 5 minutes later to ask again while we are all midchew. 
When we could talk we reported its goodness.  My experience with 3 or 4 cheese ravioli in a cream sauce is that the cheeses are muted.  Here however, the cheeses each came alive with each bite.  The sauce and the roasted pine nuts and chopped grape tomatoes were a perfect blend.  The pesto cream sauce needs to be finished, every last drop from your plate with the good bread.  
It's too good to leave a drop!
The couscous was light as air and the chicken fettucine was also mixed to combine but not overpower the natural tastes, so I was told.  
So it could have been the waiter that marred the experience but all in all, I would say it was very good but not as amazing as its San Francisco companion.

My bf and I came here one sat. night when we were walking up and down  the strip and were a lil hungry but didnt want to eat a full meal b/c  we were planning on walking a lot more and having some drinks here and there. We decided on this place b/c any further and the Male Shut down would have commenced. ladies, you know how a man gets when he doenst eat? CRANKY!!! OMG it was already too late. So we decided to share a margherita pizza and had some water since we already had one of those 1/2 yardsticks from Fat Tuesday. The waitress looked at us like we were paupers - hell like we were too poor to order our own plates. Um... we dont want to walk around with left overs so whats wrong with sharing a pizza? Really? YOU are going to lookat me like I'm "a Re-Tard" (as in the hangover). I'd never go back to this place b/c of that waitress.  I'd go across the way to the mario batalli place. Maybe they will be nicer and bring bk cliente.
Incredible meal. Amazing cheese selection, phenomenal beers, great service!

So yummy!!

Went there on Memorial Day on my lunch break with a co-worker. Sat at the bar and order bar bites. O. M. G. Outstanding. The grilled cheese with gazpacho was killer. The sliders were extremely small but had the flavor of a full size entree. They seem to have a good drink happy hour but I was on break so.....

Will definitely go back. Service was fantastic!

Had the shortrib ravioli. Fresh pasta and magnificent beef broth. Wife ordered pizza - was also very good - spicy chicken and she added goat cheese. We really enjoyed it. The menu here is similar to many of his other restaurants in Vegas, except for Spago. I find the food consistent and tasy, and priced fairly.  Setting is really cool if you sit on the patio.

I would definitely return, and this has encouraged me to try Spago the next time I'm in Vegas.

We were very impressed with Postrio. We had an excellent server who even gave a member of our party a tour of the kitchen when we asked about the pizza stove. The pasta is homemade and excellent and the pizza is very good as well. The refills on my iced tea came as soon as I put down the glass and without asking. This was by far our best meal in Vegas and we are looking forward to going back.

Went for a quick lunch (before we had to leave for the airport) and it was just fine.  The atmosphere is modern, prices are reasonable, and the location was prime.  The service wasn't the best - we had to ask for our server at least 5 times before he came over....twice.  

Food:  had the $15ish chicken salad, which sounded similar to Corner Bakery's chicken salad (yum!).  This was not as flavorful but was fine because the raisin bread which it was served on was yummy.  I'd rather have Corner Bakery's, especially at $6!

3 people ordered the primer burger - 2 ordered theirs medium, 1 asked for medium well.  All of ours came out medium rare (bright red "bleeding" in the middle of our burger).  The medium people dealth with it and ate...but it was unacceptable for the person who ordered the med well (rightfully so!) - it took 10 min for them to take it back and then another 10 min for them to bring back the same burger that came out very charred on the outside.  

Good for lunch, wouldn't go for dinner.  Expect to wait a LONG time to be seated and to get anything at your table.

so this was my first visit to vegas, and we obviously walked down the strip. the first place we went to was the venetian. so awesome

location & pricing: its right in the grand canal of shoppes and was cute - we went in the evening on christmas day and there was a little show going on right next the restaurant. we were out on the "patio" part, and had a view the entire time. thankfully we were also seated near the bar where we could keep up with the chargers/titans game too. pricing was a bit high for the things that we ate.

atmosphere: this place was cute - people milling by, comfortable setting, and pretty romantic. yes its loud, but its vegas - it'll always be loud :)

taste: alright. this is the hard part. while the atmosphere was cute, the food was not that great. the appetizers were the saving grace of this place. the spicy tuna tartare with avacado was simply superb. we also got the margherita pizza as an appetizer too (special with chicken on it! hahaha) and it was pretty darn good as well. however come time for our entrees, you would think that ordering a pasta dish would be awesome coming from an italian restaurant IN the venetian. you would be sadly mistaken. out of two spicy spaghettinis, house made lasagna, the atlantic salmon, the salmon was by far the most flavorful, clean, and satisfying in taste. the others were way too cheesy and not enough meat.

service: it was sub-par. it wouldve been borderline good if our waiter wasn't such an asshole about the guys in the kitchen. first thing he said was "i'll be right with you, im gonna go check on some dishes - they have been taking awhile to come out all day and be right back with you guys". seriously? what the heck? and we had to ask him multiple times for more water. ugh. such a turnoff for a restaurant.

all in all, go for the apps. find entrees at a different place.

I celebrated an important milestone in this fine establishment and I am so very glad I did.  We had an amazing server named Mike who took care of our table of 12.  WE had great seats outside with views of St. Marks square.  We had a round of appetizers consisting of the truffle chips, tuna tartare and crab cakes.  Sterling starters.  The entrees were beautifully prepared and because I am a meat-eater I stuck to the steak which is cooked Argentianian style, with chimichurri sauce.  Another hit.  I was full but there is always room for dessert and we indulged in the production and presentation heavy chocolate souffle.  Manna from dessert heaven.  I was happy, satiated and totally comfortable as I walked away from our table.  Kudos to the staff for making my experience unforgettable!
Wow Chef Mark rocks. From the fried calamari (best anywhere) to the pizza, gnocchi to the great cocktails and desserts. We love it here. Always great service too!

decent casino restaurant from the wolfgang puck family tree. service was ok as was the food but there wasn't anything that really stood out. the selection of wines seemed a bit limited and.. em.. top shelf supermarket-ish. not bad but there's certainly better, more challenging options out there.
A great dining experience in the heart of the Venetian waterway. The cuisine is a hybrid of American & Italian, but oh so good!

Loved this restaurant. Started with the Tuna appetizer, sweet wings, than had a goat cheese pizza. Service was impeccable. Would definitely go back again- we did not have a reservation and received a table almost immediately.

I rarely have such mixed feelings about my experience at a restaurant. It's normally a question of whether or not I left the place with a general sense of satisfaction. I still crave the dish I ordered that day (slices of garlic cloves and slivers of parmesan tend to make quite an impression on one's taste buds even weeks after consumption), but I can't weigh my entire score on the food.

The hostess made me feel like a disgusting transient as she lurched me over to a table and told me to expect a waiter soon. The waiter and the rest of the staff were fine, but I still felt as though I was the disappointment among the clientele because I was only a party of one in a city crammed with dining couples.

The rustic "artisan-style" loaf fought off my hunger for a while, but the spicy Chilean red wine and pungent, hearty pasta arrived quickly. Still, I felt little love :-( 

Lady Suzanne's hourly opera show, however, brought a tear to everyone's eye and added about two stars to my score. I'd have to say that my seat was perfect for watching this performance--as well as every other show that the Venetian hosts at the Grand Canal Shoppes. Few performers can pull off a Disney Princess persona and still retain my respect. She's bad@$$.

...Yes, I consider her to be part of the dining experience. She sure saved THIS review, didn't she?

In closing, the food and the entertainment were the strong points at this establishment. Had the hostess shown me a slightly kinder shade of contempt, maybe I could have found the heart to add another star.

Good location and service, underwhelming food. 

For brunch, I split the spaghetti and meatballs and wild mushroom pizza. Both were fine but not especially memorable. The spaghetti was huge and came with 6 enormous meatballs. While the pasta was good, the sauce and meatballs were a little bland. The pizza was a bit one-note and again, just ok. I would pass - there are better brunch and Italian restaurants in Vegas.

Disclaimer: reviewing for the fine dining area.  Not the outside cafe-style seating, not the wine - just the fine dining.

Sad.

It makes me sad that a place I'd enthusiastically give 5 stars to two years ago has fallen to 3-star status in my book.

I liked this place enough that two years ago I've taken groups of 20+ people here twice, and been here numerous times since the first week of its opening (just like Aquaknox!).

It's not really so much the price - I do not feel that it is particularly more expensive than most other Vegas equivalents.  It's certainly more expensive than the other Wolfgang Puck establishments in Vegas until Cut came to the Palazzo, but it used to be well worth the money.

Slowly, but surely, the menu deteriorated as time went on.  From the first few times where I eagerly tried many different house recommendations to my most recent visit last month - numerous favorites have either gone the ways of Houdini or had its quality drastically cut.

I'll start with the seared John Dory.  John Dory isn't often served in restaurants, but this place had it seared to perfection.  It still remains in my memory as the most tender white flaky fish I ever had.  I wish I would have ordered it more the first few years, but I did not and I regret it.

Then, the Peking Duck was a great dish as well.  Low in terms of quantity, but superb in quality.  Besides, that just saves you room for more appetizer and desert.  It's almost always sold out early on into the night.  Now, I think it's replaced by a Duck Breast entree, that just isn't nearly as tasty.  Sniff.

They used to serve (domestic) Kobe Beef here, ya know?  Kobe Beef is not my cup of tea, but everyone else loved it.  That's not there anymore either - tis a shame.

But no worries, because without the Kobe Beef - they still had a house special ribeye that was very delicious.  Actually, that's gone too.

So what *is* left that's still pretty good?

Scallops.  I can't remember if it's an appetizer or entree, but per my usual ways we order it like an appetizer.  I remember one time I was so crazy about their scallops I came here and ordered 6 orders.  I think I scallop-overdosed, but it was a very memorable experience and one I do not regret doing again.

*Edit*

I forgot about the chilled seafood platter they serve.  It's excellent - yeah, that's one reason I'd go back.  Phew, almost forgot about that!

I don't think their pasta is bad, but there's plenty of better Pasta places in Vegas.  And by better - I mean, not even comparable better.

You know, based on my most recent experience I'd have given this place two stars based on how it stacks up versus all the other possible places you can eat at in Las Vegas.  But for the sake of what it used to be, and the possibility of what it can become again one day in the future - let's leave it at 3 stars.

Eggs Benedict-delicious. First time trying this and the best so far. Perfectly poached eggs with mild and creamy hollandaise sauce. Pretty good Canadian bacon and soft and warm biscuits. The baked potatoes are too much starch.

A Wolfgang Puck restaurant  that is another 4 star place. It is very loud if you are sitting outside, but quiet and romantic inside. It is a little pricey but it is also high quality.

They quickly sat our large group and took good care of us. The hand-cut linguini with shrimp and calamari was very good, but a little miss labeled. It was labeled mildly spicy,  but it was more then mild. It got my tongue and mouth tingling after just a couple of bites. Even though I do not like spicy foods, I ate every bite because it was so good. My stomach did pay the price a little later though. 

I was also able to steel a bite of my wife's burger, and I wish I could have stolen more. The burger was fantastic and their pizzas look good too. 

This was the second fine dinning restaurant by Wolfgang Puck we went to in Vegas and both of them were a fantastic experience!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Ah, Postrio.  You get a view of a mall show (fun) and the people watching is a plus (double fun). You have given me ideas to bring home. They start your meal off with a great hummus dip. Yummers. I had a chicken salad sandwich with thin raisin toast. Oh the flavors. It was blissful and I vowed to copy it somehow someday. Worth trying if you're in the area.

I had a reservation for valentines day. We got in and were seated immediately. We were served by the busser pretty quickly and took our drink order. 

We looked at the menu and were puzzled... It was confusing as hell. To help, we looked on yelp on our phone. The waiter came by and was pretty helpful. We mentioned that we were locals and he told us we would get free desert because we were locals. Score!

They brought bread over which tasted pretty fresh. The busser brought over our drinks, I wanted an ice tea that was unsweetened but he upsold me to a mixed tea drink. He was unclear if it was unsweetened (which it wasnt) but I drank it anyway. 

We ordered fried calamari as an appetizer. It was good, soft and not too tough nor chewy. I was surprised at the taste of the Thai sweet sauce compared to the marinara. I actually would prefer the Thai sauce now! I recommend this dish. 

I ordered the lobster ravioli and my wife ordered the cheese and bolgnese. We waited for a little bit but not as long as I thought it would take from the other yelpers. The portion size is pretty good, im a large eater and was pretty satisfied. I got about 6 large pieces of ravioli. (which came to my head... $30 dish = $5 per ravioli)My lobster was a bit on the salty side, but the sauce was mixed very well and completed the taste. Everything tasted very fresh. The ingredients, top quality food (compared to olive garden, macaroni grill etc) however it is pricey but we would come back once in a while. Not all the time, way too pricey. 

We got our free desert, and it was delicious. Something we wouldn't pay for but very good. We got the little chocolate cake balls filled with Chocolate lava inside. 

All in all, we loved the atmosphere. Very touristy since we are locals but it's a nice change of pace. We noticed the other customers were more of an upper class type but I'm just speaking on behalf of an average joe. I typically goto fine dining places once in a while but I would choose other places than here. They had a few free shows while we dined so that was a good time. I'd actually put 3.5 stars if I could. Only 3 because of the price.

After three years, went back to Postrio with my brother and s-i-l. It was just as good as last time. The caesar salad is my absolute favorite. Our dinners were superb. The prices are very reasonable for Vegas. All in all a wonderful experience. We'll be back.

Friday night, got a table immediately at 7pm....
Imported beer (Belgian $14 )

opted for 2 apps and a pizza -
Short ribs were okay. Little on the fatty side.
Calamari - to die for. Lightly breaded with light colored flour and VERY tender. I live in FL and have had eaten many calamari dishes and these were far and away THE BEST we have ever eaten.

Pizza - okay, nothing special.

Service was superb....

I'm reviewing Postrio after eating there two separate times.  If you are staying at the Venetian or at the Palazzo, this is an excellent option for fine dining.  My husband grew up in Germany, so he shares Wolfgang Puck's love and admiration for all things schnitzel, hence a return visit.  

Most people were eating in the "outside" patio, where you can enjoy the beautiful faux Venice ambiance.  The lighting in this courtyard area is truly spectacular.  But, it is really loud and you are usually subject to some "entertainment" on the nearby stage, which has terrible sound.  So, we opted to eat inside the restaurant which was sleek and modern and quiet.  I much preferred this to the patio option, personally.

Our server was prompt and knowledgeable; accomodating without condescention.  We were served several kinds of bread, including a remarkably light and flavorful foccacia. We started our meal sharing the apple salad which was, quite possibly, the best salad I have ever eaten.  The ingredients in the salad were all top-quality and the salad had a perfect balance of textures and flavors, featuring morsels of aged blue cheese and spiced marcona almonds.  The fennel was shaved thin and the apples were mandolined; both kept crisp in ice water until immediately before plating.  I highly recommend this salad as I have never had anything quite like it anywhere else.

My husband had the schnitzel, served with a warm mustard sauce.  The pork was pounded flat and the breading was uniformly crisp and not overly heavy.  It came with a very small amount of potatoes and roasted tomatoes, that appeared almost an after thought to the huge pork cutlet dominating the plate.  The waiter told us this is always on the menu as it reminds Wolfgang Puck of his Austrian upbringing and he does the dish proud.  I ordered the Cioppino, featuring shrimp, clams and fish.  It was good, not great.  The seafood had fresh flavor and firm texture and was not overcooked.  The broth was heavily scented from fennel and tomatoes.  I don't know Cioppino as a dish very well, but I would be surprised if this is as good as it gets.  

All in all, a good option for those visiting the Las Vegas strip.  It's pricey, but certainly not the most expensive option in a very high-dollar area.  And, the menu offers a variety for those looking for a break from the Italian and steakhouse options available elsewhere.
I really liked Postrio. The food was good, the service was friendly and inviting and it wasn't super pretentious. We ate here immediately after arriving at the Venetian and really enjoyed our time.

Postrio is located at the Venetian's Grand Canal Shoppes, Postrio presents a menu of seasonal, modern American cuisine with global influences that can be enjoyed on the casual, "indoor" patio overlooking the Carnivale atmosphere of St.  Mark's Square or in the modern dining room.  A sleek, bronze-paneled bar extends into the café and a row of sophisticated leather booths are set within tile "cabanas," forming an intimate lounge along the bar. 

I was here two times for group business dinners during a recent trade show convention. The first time was a rather large group of about 80 people, while the second time was a smaller group of about 25 people. The organic baby kale salad with artichoke, spring onion, baby carrots and feta cheese was very nice. In fact the quality of the feta cheese was very unusual.

Both times I ordered the steak entre and both times I was very pleased with the quality of my steak and the table service here. I know that serving a large group is very difficult. I would return for a regular dinner here.

Went to Vegas and stayed at Palazzo... I was searching for a good restaurant and noticed this was a Wolfgang Puck restaurant, so we decided to go here, we knew we wouldn't be disappointed. I ordered the calamari (it was an appetizer, I chose to eat it as my main meal), it was ok... not much flavor, but there were peppers all over the place, which gave it some sort of taste. I've definitely had better calamari elsewhere.. wouldn't recommend it. For dessert... I ordered the chocolate beignet's... loved them- a taste of heaven! Rich, moist, and fresh, and the ice cream they served with it made it even better! So I would definitely recommend that for you chocolate lovers out there! The ambiance was nice... and we were seated outside (not really outside but  they considered it patio seating) so we got to enjoy the entertainment that was going on... which was probably the best part about dinner!

My partner and I ate here for xmas dinner and had the 3 course holiday menu.  It was good but not exceptional.  I had the osso bucco which as good but not great.  It was served with the butcher string still on it which is a major no no for chefs and it was lacking a little seasoning, sauce and gremolata. It just needed somethign to make it exceptional.  My partner had the scallops which were very good but the plate basically had the 3 average sized scallops and nothing else. It seemed more like an appetizer.  Good thing we had the dessert course afterwards, which was excellent, or he would have been hungry.    The service was great even though they were very busy. Overall a good meal. I would try again.

We were looking to try something different during our stay here and while we walking around in the Venetian, we spotted this place near the canals. It looked like an interesting place and the menu looked pretty good.

They have two dining areas for Postrio: one "outside" in front of the restaurant and the other inside. If you like the hustle and bustle and the energy of the canals, then outside is definitely for you. Tonight we kind of want a quieter dining atmosphere and chose to sit inside.

We were both wanting seafood and so we ordered:
* Crispy Calamari with Zucchini and Olives, Spicy Tomato Sauce and Garlic Aioli - this was pretty good. better than your everyday calamari you might get at like a TGI Fridays, but not even close to Mesa Grill or B&B's version. it was worth it though to start.
* Linguini with Clams, Garlic, Pancetta, Chili and Parsley - this was my entree. it was ever so slightly above average. the clams were washed perfectly so there wasn't any grit but they were a little on the small side. overall the dish wasn't bad.
* Seafood Ravioli, Clams, Mussels, Calamari, Shrimp, Bay Scallops, Tomatoes, Roasted Peppers - this was my gf entree... I grabbed a small quick bite. same story as above.

We had a few drinks with the meal and overall it was pretty good.  I will admit there really wasn't anything that was a WOW or substantially stood out in the meal, but everything was cooked perfectly and the food was good. I will definitely give them points for not screwing up all the seafood we ordered (believe me I have seen some disasters before) and it was a good experience.

Went to Postrio with my mom and 2 sisters on a Vegas 4-day girls trip. It was our Thursday night choice and we were all very pleased! I made a reservation and was immediately seated. The hostess told me that they don't seat inside the restaurant during the weekdays but it worked out perfectly because we wanted to sit "outside" (in St. Marks Square). I am a vegetarian so I ordered a salad, I think the menu is different from the on online because I can't find it. But it was definitely yummy! Good portion too. We ordered 3 pizzas, the wood oven roasted mushrooms/leeks/rosemary/goat cheese, house made pepperoni/kalamata olives/slow roasted tomatoes and the 'margheria' pizza. All were super big and very tasty. The hostess asked if we were celebrating anything and it was my older sister's birthday so after we ate they brought out this very gorgeous raspberry souffle with 3 different small bowls of sauce. The waiter then takes his spoon and breaks open the souffle and pours each one in as he explains what they are. WOW it was magnificant! I wouldn't usually order something that is raspberry but now I will definitely give it chance! It was $11 and he took it off the bill, very nice! Overall great restaurant - definitely worth the try if you in the area :)

Went to Postrio for dinner prior to a show.  Had reservations and sat on the patio.  High energy atmosphere in The Venetian's St. Marks Square, with Street Performer type shows going on in the surrounding square.  

Shared the Salmon and Seafood Risotto - Salmon was excellent but risotto was a little undercooked.  The server was attentive and professional.  Prices are moderate for Las Vegas.

Frankly, Postrio did not impress.  I expected a little more from a Wolfgang Puck restaurant simply from a food quality standpoint.  While I would suggest it as a viable option if staying at The Venetian. I would not return simply because of the vast number of options in Las Vegas, and would not recommend traveling from a different hotel to check it out.

I think of this as not as good as Spago, but still a reliable place for some tasty eats if you don't want to leave the environs of the Venetian. I tend to go for the specials as they have been reliably good - but I ask the waiter if in doubt and have not been steered wrong. This time it was the wild mushroom ravioli, and they were delicious. Bread is good, though not as yummy as it is at Spago.

It is in the shops at the Venetian next to the stage so one can watch the performances. This is both a good thing and a bad thing since I could not hear what the staff was saying while the performances were going on, but other members of my party seemed to enjoy the experience. Due to the place being inside the shops, the ceiling is painted as the sky, so it's kind of hard to classify it as "outside" or "inside" seating, since the seating we were placed at was inside the mall's open air plaza. I think I'll avoid discussing this since I'm not sure how to describe it.

The food is particularly expensive, but once again, someone else paid for me. Taste-wise, it is slightly better than the places I've compared to from Orange County with no sourness in the food and no low-quality ingredients from what I can tell. They were nice enough to inform us of any potential food allergies we could encounter. The food came out at an acceptable speed, though we received our appetizers first so we could begin eating first. They gave us separate bowls for any items we could share, like soup. What comes with the food is standard, there is nothing noteworthy about it other than the taste.

First Wolfgang Puck experience and it was superb!! I had the quail dish and it was the most delicious plate of bird I've ever had! service is top notch and they take very good care of their customers here! Don't forget to save room for dessert!

Coming dressed extra nice will help you bypass the line and get you a table inside!

Fantastic location (St Marks Sq), excellent service and great food. The roast beef panini was great. When my panini arrived I thought I might not be able to eat the whole thing because the portion size was huge. But it was so tasty that ate it all and all of the frys. I had a couple of glasses of red wine and an ice tea to wash it down. Great place to grab a bite. You are eating at a celebrity chef's restaurant in prime real estate inside venetiaian so expect to pay a premium.

My husband entered the Venetian mall after both of us crossed a river of rainwater and soaked our shoes and socks. We decided to eat at Postrio after a quick cross reference on Yelp!. We devoured the country white bread (perfectly crusty and tender) that was served with a flavorful tapenade. I ordered the mushroom tortollini in cream sauce and he ordered the lasagna. Both were heavenly and the portion size was perfect! The food was so good that we completely forgot about how miserable we were just half an hour earlier.

We sat at the bar for drinks and food.  The bartender was sorta shmoozy but also mildly condescending, but he made drinks and I wasn't expecting a new best friend.  We had:
Calamari - bland
Cauliflower  - beautiful, multicolored roasted cauliflower, gorgeous and tasty and well prepared
Apple salad - very good, great dressing, good portions, and they split it for us without us asking, when we said we would be sharing the appetizers
Martinis - dirty martinis with blue cheese stuffed olives

The bathroom is so dark, you need a flashlight or your phone light if you are going to try to redo your makeup or lipstick.

Overall it was ok, but certainly not a great experience, and it feels weird eating in what is essentially a roped off area of a main lobby.  Eh, I wouldn't go out of my way to go back.

Three stars does not befit how I felt about the food, rather the service.  I've eaten here twice, and both times service was sketchy.  I must clarify, however, that both times I ate in the cafe area, which is "outside" and not inside, which is where the fine dining is housed.  

To the important stuff, first the food:  I've been there with two separate parties, and we all really enjoyed the new american/mediterranean style food.  I always judge a restaurant by their french fries, so of course we started off with the pommes frites.  Perfectly seasoned, hot and crispy.  The aioli was a good accompaniment, but a tad on the rich side.  Besides, we still had loads full of starches to come.  Next we tried some of the flat bread pizzas.  Wolfgang Puck is famous for these, so you can't go to one of his places without trying these.  I love prosciutto, so the prosciutto with mission figs and blue cheese had to touch my taste buds.  I was pleasantly surprised by the crispiness of the crust despite the amount of toppings offered.  Also pleasantly surprising was how the blue cheese did not completely overwhelm the whole pizza.  My bf tried the spicy chorizo pizza, and he being a super carnivore, was very pleased.  

When I went with my mother, we split the fettuccine with english peas and arugula and the linguine with clams.   Both pastas were divine.  Although I love classic Italian pastas, al dente, if you are strict about this, then please be aware that the pastas at Postrio are freshly made and not dry.  

Portions here are very generous.  This is a welcome treat seeing as how every meal in Vegas can seem way too expensive, yet too small.  Hear that, Batali?  Now on to the bummerific:

The service is terrrible.  This is a blanket statement despite the fact that the food runners and bussers are very sweet.  Why, you ask?  The hostesses have a perpetual model scowl on their faces, I can never tell if the waiters are being sarcastic or if they really just need to be somewhere else, and the food takes foreeeeeever to come out.  I can deal with surly waiters (even if I still do tip 20%), and I can deal with a grumpy hostess, but I cannot starve while waiting for my food when there are only two other tables in the restaurant.  

So if you want to eat well, and can overlook the negatives, I suggest Postrio.  But if you're looking for atmosphere, look elsewhere.
Yes...I'm a Wolfgang fan! Have had some AWESOME meals at this Postrio.

Located conveniently (and beautifully) in the fabulous Venetian, where my two friends and I stayed, we decided to come here for my friend's birthday lunch. It was very typical food on the menu--salads, hamburgers, pasta, etc. I ordered a chinese chicken salad and ate about half of it. Maybe it was because I wasn't in the mood to eat, but it just didn't do it for me. Not sweet enough and just pretty mediocre. The atmosphere is gorgeous though, inside the Grand Canal Shoppes. I would likely not go back because of the food, but the location, speed of service and atmosphere makes up for it (almost).

So incredibly pricey! For the price...not sure if it's worth it. Waiter was good and we were seated so that we could look at all the people shopping outside. Our order:

Calamari: Gluten free whaaaaat? But yes, it is! Not super crispy, but definitely nice flavor though slightly bland. Sweet and sour sauce instead of traditional cocktail/marinara. Not bad.

Caesar salad: Very fresh and crispy. For the price of $13 though? It really was a slab of romaine lettuce with dressing...

Roasted chicken with BBQ sauce pizza: Bf did not like this at all. Sauce was lacking and chicken was dry. Pizza crust was dense, yet tried to be a thin crust...not crispy. Honestly, the flavor just tasted off to me.

Kurobuta pork schnitzel: Um, it was a dry pork cutlet mashed thin and fried. The whole grain mustard sauce was good, but $27 for a pork cutlet is just not acceptable. Do not get this! Looks plain and tastes like it too! My friend did not even bother to finish it and ate her bf's food instead.

Free range chicken: Half a chicken over very smooth, slightly buttery potato puree. Veggies (brussel sprouts) were pretty good. the chicken was well seasoned and the natural au jus was flavorful as well, however some of the chicken was still dry. It is difficult to make moist chicken breast though, so I can't complain too much. 

Overall, for the price we are paying, I expected more. I'll come here if my friend wants to go again, but I probably would not come here on my own, especially considering that Venetian offers so many wonderful restaurants.
Puck always delivers.  Nice portions.  Someone I came with on my last trip even ordered the burger lol, but it was definitely a cadillac of burgers.

I'm a fan of the free mimosa, but there really wasn't enough food for the price.  I think I had the omelette and it was just...really kinda generic.  There was no real flavor besides the egg, the potatoes were bland, and the price was like double what the tastes were worth.  That is to say, a typical Vegas price for rather mediocre food.

I have to say the ambiance is pretty great, but I would put that on the Venetian rather than the restaurant itself.  I admit I would probably hate those performances if I worked here, though.

I am surprised that people still get duped by the Wolfgang Puck name. He's sold out and I would've too if I had any culinary talent. BUT his diluting attention is obvious at each of his restaurants.

We went there since we had 20% off. The service was nice but so fucking lazy. It took forever to get anything and the staff was so forgetful. I ordered tea with milk and sugar. I got the tea, had to ask for the milk twice and then kept getting false promises that the sugar was on its way. After 15 minutes I got it. It wasn't crowded and the staff was just hanging out.

The Caesar salad was decent, served with the leaves whole but the dressing was so mild and scant. I will admit that my gf's lasagna was delicious but my pancetta wrapped meatloaf was dry and lacked pancetta.

On the last day of our MDW Vegas trip, our group wanted to grab brunch together before we all left. We were lazy to leave the Venetian we were staying at so we decided to walk around the shops and find something to our liking... Obviously we chose Postrio! 

Their menu was divided into brunch, small plate, medium plate, and large plate options. I think everyone in our party chose something from the brunch section! Our waiter gave us fantastic service, I wish I remembered his name! I love that he always served the ladies first and tried to make pleasant conversation with us whenever he came to check up on the table. We also each got a complimentary mimosa with our entrees! Yummy ;D

Everyone was happy with their food :) The favorites were the eggs benedicts which you could get with either traditional canadian bacon, smoked salmon, lobster, or vegetarian. Mmm I got the lobster benedict and it was amaaazing with huge chunks of lobster. They definitely did not skimp out on me!

Great atmosphere, great company, great food = couldn't be happier!!
I wanted chicken Alfredo and they didn't have it on the menu but the chef made it for me and no lie it was probably the best chicken Alfredo I have ever had seriously amazing!!!

There's a reason this guy became so successful. 

Our dinner at Postrio was an almost flawless experience and unfortunately the first "touch point" was the single negative. The young maitre 'd was sullen and humorless (I assume she was the obligatory aspiring actress/model/weather girl) and felt that a smile was simply too much for her soon=to-be-famous face. 

Once our brush with imminenet celebrity was done the rest of the dinner was outstanding. Our waitress, and indeed everyone who hovered around, delivered to  or checked on our table was warm and friendly and totally professional. 

The experience of dining under the faux stars of the Venetian Piazza was wonderful and greatly enhanced by the string quartet playing to our right. 

But the highlight of the evening was of course the food. As I have said before I am not a foodie, but both our meals were remarkably good. I had the mushroom risotto and my girlfriend had the schnitzel and both fell squarely into the category of best meal I've ever eaten. Risotto can get a bit monotonous but this meal so so wonderfully prepared each mouthful was an intriguing blend of interesting spices. The schnitzel itself was a tad bland until you applied the sauce which complemented the meat so perfectly that it was transformed into an entirely different dish.

If you are heading to Vegas and are thinking about a casual romantic dinner at a great restaurant (for a surprisingly reasonable cost I might add) it would be hard to do better than Postrio
Don't come here.  The service was terrible.  It took 15 minutes just to get water and the portions are non existent.....
